ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS

block.text: KISAH PARA RASUL

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 1
Dear Theophilus, in my first book, I told all that Jesus did and taught from the beginning

block.text: Hai Teofilus, dalam bukuku yang pertama aku menulis tentang segala sesuatu yang dikerjakan dan diajarkan Yesus,

ReferenceBlocks.text: until he ascended to heaven. He chose men as apostles, and before ascending into heaven, he gave them His commandments by the power of the Holy Spirit.

block.text: sampai pada hari Ia terangkat. Sebelum itu Ia telah memberi perintah-Nya oleh Roh Kudus kepada rasul-rasul yang dipilih-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: To these he also showed himself alive after he suffered, by many infallible proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days, and speaking about God's Kingdom.

block.text: Kepada mereka Ia menunjukkan diri-Nya setelah penderitaan-Nya selesai, dan dengan banyak tanda Ia membuktikan, bahwa Ia hidup. Sebab selama empat puluh hari Ia berulang-ulang menampakkan diri dan berbicara kepada mereka tentang Kerajaan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being assembled together with them, he commanded them,

block.text: Pada suatu hari ketika Ia makan bersama-sama dengan mereka, Ia melarang mereka meninggalkan Yerusalem, dan menyuruh mereka tinggal di situ menantikan janji Bapa, yang—demikian kata-Nya—

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which you heard from me.

block.text: <<telah kamu dengar dari pada-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”

block.text: Sebab Yohanes membaptis dengan air, tetapi tidak lama lagi kamu akan dibaptis dengan Roh Kudus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when they had come together, they asked him,

block.text: Maka bertanyalah mereka yang berkumpul di situ:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, are you now restoring the kingdom to Israel?”

block.text: <<Tuhan, maukah Engkau pada masa ini memulihkan kerajaan bagi Israel?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It isn't for you to know times or seasons which the Father has set within his own authority.

block.text: <<Engkau tidak perlu mengetahui masa dan waktu, yang ditetapkan Bapa sendiri menurut kuasa-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you. You will be witnesses to me in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the uttermost parts of the earth.”

block.text: Tetapi kamu akan menerima kuasa, kalau Roh Kudus turun ke atas kamu, dan kamu akan menjadi saksi-Ku di Yerusalem dan di seluruh Yudea dan Samaria dan sampai ke ujung bumi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said these things, as they were looking, he was taken up, and a cloud received him out of their sight.

block.text: Sesudah Ia mengatakan demikian, terangkatlah Ia disaksikan oleh mereka, dan awan menutup-Nya dari pandangan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While they were looking steadfastly into the sky as he went, behold, two men stood by them in white clothing,
who also said,

block.text: Ketika mereka sedang menatap ke langit waktu Ia naik itu, tiba-tiba berdirilah dua orang yang berpakaian putih dekat mereka,
dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into the sky? This Jesus, who was received up from you into the sky will come back in the same way as you saw him going into the sky.”

block.text: <<Hai orang-orang Galilea, mengapakah kamu berdiri melihat ke langit? Yesus ini, yang terangkat ke sorga meninggalkan kamu, akan datang kembali dengan cara yang sama seperti kamu melihat Dia naik ke sorga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day's journey away.

block.text: Maka kembalilah rasul-rasul itu ke Yerusalem dari bukit yang disebut Bukit Zaitun, yang hanya seperjalanan Sabat jauhnya dari Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come in, they went up into the upper room, where they were staying. Those present were: Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.

block.text: Setelah mereka tiba di kota, naiklah mereka ke ruang atas, tempat mereka menumpang. Mereka itu ialah Petrus dan Yohanes, Yakobus dan Andreas, Filipus dan Tomas, Bartolomeus dan Matius, Yakobus bin Alfeus, dan Simon orang Zelot dan Yudas bin Yakobus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All these with one accord continued steadfastly in prayer and supplication, along with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.

block.text: Mereka semua bertekun dengan sehati dalam doa bersama-sama, dengan beberapa perempuan serta Maria, ibu Yesus, dan dengan saudara-saudara Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In these days, Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples (and the number of names was about one hundred twenty), and said,

block.text: Pada hari-hari itu berdirilah Petrus di tengah-tengah saudara-saudara yang sedang berkumpul itu, kira-kira seratus dua puluh orang banyaknya, lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, it was necessary that this Scripture should be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who was guide to those who took Jesus.

block.text: <<Hai saudara-saudara, haruslah genap nas Kitab Suci, yang disampaikan Roh Kudus dengan perantaraan Daud tentang Yudas, pemimpin orang-orang yang menangkap Yesus itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he was numbered with us, and received his portion in this ministry.

block.text: Dahulu ia termasuk bilangan kami dan mengambil bagian di dalam pelayanan ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now this man obtained a field with the reward for his wickedness, and falling headlong, his body burst open, and all his intestines gushed out.

block.text: —Yudas ini telah membeli sebidang tanah dengan upah kejahatannya, lalu ia jatuh tertelungkup, dan perutnya terbelah sehingga semua isi perutnya tertumpah ke luar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It became known to everyone who lived in Jerusalem that in their language that field was called ‘Akeldama,’ that is, ‘The field of blood.’

block.text: Hal itu diketahui oleh semua penduduk Yerusalem, sehingga tanah itu mereka sebut dalam bahasa mereka sendiri <<Hakal-Dama>>, artinya Tanah Darah—.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is written in the book of Psalms, ‘Let his habitation be made desolate. Let no one dwell therein;’ and, ‘Let another take his office.’”

block.text: <<Sebab ada tertulis dalam kitab Mazmur: Biarlah perkemahannya menjadi sunyi, dan biarlah tidak ada penghuni di dalamnya: dan: Biarlah jabatannya diambil orang lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore, the man who will replace Judas should be one of the men who accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus was with us.

block.text: Jadi harus ditambahkan kepada kami seorang dari mereka yang senantiasa datang berkumpul dengan kami selama Tuhan Yesus bersama-sama dengan kami,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He must have been with Jesus from the day he was baptised by John, to the day that he was received up to Heaven from us. He must become a witness with us of his resurrection.”

block.text: yaitu mulai dari baptisan Yohanes sampai hari Yesus terangkat ke sorga meninggalkan kami, untuk menjadi saksi dengan kami tentang kebangkitan-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
They prayed, and said,

block.text: Lalu mereka mengusulkan dua orang: Yusuf yang disebut Barsabas dan yang juga bernama Yustus, dan Matias.
Mereka semua berdoa dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You, Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which one of these two you have chosen
to take part in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas fell away, that he might go to his own place.”

block.text: <<Ya Tuhan, Engkaulah yang mengenal hati semua orang, tunjukkanlah kiranya siapa yang Engkau pilih dari kedua orang ini,
untuk menerima jabatan pelayanan, yaitu kerasulan yang ditinggalkan Yudas yang telah jatuh ke tempat yang wajar baginya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They drew lots for them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.

block.text: Lalu mereka membuang undi bagi kedua orang itu dan yang kena undi adalah Matias dan dengan demikian ia ditambahkan kepada bilangan kesebelas rasul itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 2
Now when the day of Pentecost had come, they were all with one accord in one place.

block.text: Ketika tiba hari Pentakosta, semua orang percaya berkumpul di satu tempat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Suddenly there came from the sky a sound like the rushing of a mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.

block.text: Tiba-tiba turunlah dari langit suatu bunyi seperti tiupan angin keras yang memenuhi seluruh rumah, di mana mereka duduk;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Tongues like fire appeared and were distributed to them, and one sat on each of them.

block.text: dan tampaklah kepada mereka lidah-lidah seperti nyala api yang bertebaran dan hinggap pada mereka masing-masing.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other languages, as the Spirit gave them the ability to speak.

block.text: Maka penuhlah mereka dengan Roh Kudus, lalu mereka mulai berkata-kata dalam bahasa-bahasa lain, seperti yang diberikan oleh Roh itu kepada mereka untuk mengatakannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under the sky.

block.text: Waktu itu di Yerusalem diam orang-orang Yahudi yang saleh dari segala bangsa di bawah kolong langit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When this sound was heard, the multitude came together, and were bewildered, because everyone heard them speaking in his own language.

block.text: Ketika turun bunyi itu, berkerumunlah orang banyak. Mereka bingung karena mereka masing-masing mendengar rasul-rasul itu berkata-kata dalam bahasa mereka sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another,

block.text: Mereka semua tercengang-cengang dan heran, lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, aren't all these who speak Galileans?

block.text: <<Bukankah mereka semua yang berkata-kata itu orang Galilea?

ReferenceBlocks.text: How do we hear, everyone in our own native language?

block.text: Bagaimana mungkin kita masing-masing mendengar mereka berkata-kata dalam bahasa kita sendiri, yaitu bahasa yang kita pakai di negeri asal kita:

ReferenceBlocks.text: Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and people from Mesopotamia, Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia,

block.text: kita orang Partia, Media, Elam, penduduk Mesopotamia, Yudea dan Kapadokia, Pontus dan Asia,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, the parts of Libya around Cyrene, visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,

block.text: Frigia dan Pamfilia, Mesir dan daerah-daerah Libia yang berdekatan dengan Kirene, pendatang-pendatang dari Roma,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Cretans and Arabians: we hear them speaking in our languages the mighty works of God!”

block.text: baik orang Yahudi maupun penganut agama Yahudi, orang Kreta dan orang Arab, kita mendengar mereka berkata-kata dalam bahasa kita sendiri tentang perbuatan-perbuatan besar yang dilakukan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all amazed, and were perplexed, saying one to another,

block.text: Mereka semuanya tercengang-cengang dan sangat termangu-mangu sambil berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does this mean?”

block.text: <<Apakah artinya ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others, mocking, said,

block.text: Tetapi orang lain menyindir:

block.characterId: Jews, God-fearing from every nation, some

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews, God-fearing from every nation, some
ReferenceBlocks.text: “They are filled with new wine.”

block.text: Mereka sedang mabuk oleh anggur manis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spoke out to them,

block.text: Maka bangkitlah Petrus berdiri dengan kesebelas rasul itu, dan dengan suara nyaring ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Judea, and all you who dwell at Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words.

block.text: <<Hai kamu orang Yahudi dan kamu semua yang tinggal di Yerusalem, ketahuilah dan camkanlah perkataanku ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For these aren't drunken, as you suppose, seeing it is only the third hour of the day.

block.text: Orang-orang ini tidak mabuk seperti yang kamu sangka, karena hari baru pukul sembilan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But this is what has been spoken through the prophet Joel:

block.text: tetapi itulah yang difirmankan Allah dengan perantaraan nabi Yoel:>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘It will be in the last days, says God, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh. Your sons and your daughters will prophesy. Your young men will see visions. Your old men will dream dreams.

block.text: <<Akan terjadi pada hari-hari terakhir—demikianlah firman Allah—bahwa Aku akan mencurahkan Roh-Ku ke atas semua manusia; maka anak-anakmu laki-laki dan perempuan akan bernubuat, dan teruna-terunamu akan mendapat penglihatan-penglihatan, dan orang-orangmu yang tua akan mendapat mimpi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yes, and on my servants and on my handmaidens in those days, I will pour out my Spirit, and they will prophesy.

block.text: Juga ke atas hamba-hamba-Ku laki-laki dan perempuan akan Kucurahkan Roh-Ku pada hari-hari itu dan mereka akan bernubuat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will show wonders in the sky above, and signs on the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and billows of smoke.

block.text: Dan Aku akan mengadakan mujizat-mujizat di atas, di langit dan tanda-tanda di bawah, di bumi: darah dan api dan gumpalan-gumpalan asap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes.

block.text: Matahari akan berubah menjadi gelap gulita dan bulan menjadi darah sebelum datangnya hari Tuhan, hari yang besar dan mulia itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It will be, that whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.’”

block.text: Dan barangsiapa yang berseru kepada nama Tuhan akan diselamatkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men of Israel, hear these words! Jesus of Nazareth was a man approved by God to you by mighty works and wonders and signs which God did by him in the midst of you, even as you yourselves know.

block.text: <<Hai orang-orang Israel, dengarlah perkataan ini: Yang aku maksudkan, ialah Yesus dari Nazaret, seorang yang telah ditentukan Allah dan yang dinyatakan kepadamu dengan kekuatan-kekuatan dan mujizat-mujizat dan tanda-tanda yang dilakukan oleh Allah dengan perantaraan Dia di tengah-tengah kamu, seperti yang kamu tahu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was handed over to you by the determined counsel and foreknowledge of God, and you, with the help of wicked men, put him to death by nailing him to a cross.

block.text: Dia yang diserahkan Allah menurut maksud dan rencana-Nya, telah kamu salibkan dan kamu bunuh oleh tangan bangsa-bangsa durhaka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: whom God raised up, having freed him from the agony of death, because it was not possible that he should be held by it.

block.text: Tetapi Allah membangkitkan Dia dengan melepaskan Dia dari sengsara maut, karena tidak mungkin Ia tetap berada dalam kuasa maut itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For David says concerning him, ‘I saw the Lord always before my face, For he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved.

block.text: Sebab Daud berkata tentang Dia:>> <<Aku senantiasa memandang kepada Tuhan, karena Ia berdiri di sebelah kananku, aku tidak goyah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced. Moreover my flesh also will dwell in hope.

block.text: Sebab itu hatiku bersukacita dan jiwaku bersorak-sorak, bahkan tubuhku akan diam dengan tenteram,

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will not leave my soul in Hades, neither will you allow your Holy One to see decay.

block.text: sebab Engkau tidak menyerahkan aku kepada dunia orang mati, dan tidak membiarkan Orang Kudus-Mu melihat kebinasaan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You made known to me the ways of life. You will make me full of gladness with your presence.’”

block.text: Engkau memberitahukan kepadaku jalan kehidupan; Engkau akan melimpahi aku dengan sukacita di hadapan-Mu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, I may tell you freely of the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.

block.text: <<Saudara-saudara, aku boleh berkata-kata dengan terus terang kepadamu tentang Daud, bapa bangsa kita. Ia telah mati dan dikubur, dan kuburannya masih ada pada kita sampai hari ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, he would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne,

block.text: Tetapi ia adalah seorang nabi dan ia tahu, bahwa Allah telah berjanji kepadanya dengan mengangkat sumpah, bahwa Ia akan mendudukkan seorang dari keturunan Daud sendiri di atas takhtanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: he foreseeing this spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that neither was his soul left in Hades, nor did his flesh see decay.

block.text: <<Karena itu ia telah melihat ke depan dan telah berbicara tentang kebangkitan Mesias, ketika ia mengatakan, bahwa Dia tidak ditinggalkan di dalam dunia orang mati, dan bahwa daging-Nya tidak mengalami kebinasaan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This Jesus God raised up, to which we all are witnesses.

block.text: Yesus inilah yang dibangkitkan Allah, dan tentang hal itu kami semua adalah saksi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being therefore exalted by the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this, which you now see and hear.

block.text: Dan sesudah Ia ditinggikan oleh tangan kanan Allah dan menerima Roh Kudus yang dijanjikan itu, maka dicurahkan-Nya apa yang kamu lihat dan dengar di sini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For David didn't ascend into the heavens, but he says himself, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit by my right hand,
until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”’”

block.text: Sebab bukan Daud yang naik ke sorga, malahan Daud sendiri berkata:>> <<Tuhan telah berfirman kepada Tuanku:
<Duduklah di sebelah kanan-Ku, sampai Kubuat musuh-musuh-Mu menjadi tumpuan kaki-Mu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let all the house of Israel therefore know certainly that God has made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified.”

block.text: Jadi seluruh kaum Israel harus tahu dengan pasti, bahwa Allah telah membuat Yesus, yang kamu salibkan itu, menjadi Tuhan dan Kristus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles,

block.text: Ketika mereka mendengar hal itu hati mereka sangat terharu, lalu mereka bertanya kepada Petrus dan rasul-rasul yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, what shall we do?”

block.text: <<Apakah yang harus kami perbuat, saudara-saudara?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said to them,

block.text: Jawab Petrus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Repent, and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

block.text: <<Bertobatlah dan hendaklah kamu masing-masing memberi dirimu dibaptis dalam nama Yesus Kristus untuk pengampunan dosamu, maka kamu akan menerima karunia Roh Kudus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far off, even as many as the Lord our God will call to himself.”

block.text: Sebab bagi kamulah janji itu dan bagi anak-anakmu dan bagi orang yang masih jauh, yaitu sebanyak yang akan dipanggil oleh Tuhan Allah kita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: With many other words he testified, and exhorted them, saying,

block.text: Dan dengan banyak perkataan lain lagi ia memberi suatu kesaksian yang sungguh-sungguh dan ia mengecam dan menasihati mereka, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Save yourselves from this crooked generation!”

block.text: <<Berilah dirimu diselamatkan dari angkatan yang jahat ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then those who gladly received his word were baptized. There were added that day about three thousand souls.

block.text: Orang-orang yang menerima perkataannya itu memberi diri dibaptis dan pada hari itu jumlah mereka bertambah kira-kira tiga ribu jiwa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They continued steadfastly in the apostles’ teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and prayer.

block.text: Mereka bertekun dalam pengajaran rasul-rasul dan dalam persekutuan. Dan mereka selalu berkumpul untuk memecahkan roti dan berdoa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Fear came on every soul, and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.

block.text: Maka ketakutanlah mereka semua, sedang rasul-rasul itu mengadakan banyak mujizat dan tanda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All who believed were together, and had all things in common.

block.text: Dan semua orang yang telah menjadi percaya tetap bersatu, dan segala kepunyaan mereka adalah kepunyaan bersama,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sold their possessions and goods, and distributed them to all, according as anyone had need.

block.text: dan selalu ada dari mereka yang menjual harta miliknya, lalu membagi-bagikannya kepada semua orang sesuai dengan keperluan masing-masing.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Day by day, continuing steadfastly with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread at home, they took their food with gladness and singleness of heart.

block.text: Dengan bertekun dan dengan sehati mereka berkumpul tiap-tiap hari dalam Bait Allah. Mereka memecahkan roti di rumah masing-masing secara bergilir dan makan bersama-sama dengan gembira dan dengan tulus hati,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They praised God, and had favor with all the people. The Lord added to the assembly day by day those who were being saved.

block.text: sambil memuji Allah. Dan mereka disukai semua orang. Dan tiap-tiap hari Tuhan menambah jumlah mereka dengan orang yang diselamatkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 3
Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.

block.text: Pada suatu hari menjelang waktu sembahyang, yaitu pukul tiga petang, naiklah Petrus dan Yohanes ke Bait Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain man who was lame from his mother's womb was being carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask gifts for the needy of those who entered into the temple.

block.text: Di situ ada seorang laki-laki, yang lumpuh sejak lahirnya sehingga ia harus diusung. Tiap-tiap hari orang itu diletakkan dekat pintu gerbang Bait Allah, yang bernama Gerbang Indah, untuk meminta sedekah kepada orang yang masuk ke dalam Bait Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked to receive gifts for the needy.
Peter, fastening his eyes on him, with John, said,

block.text: Ketika orang itu melihat, bahwa Petrus dan Yohanes hendak masuk ke Bait Allah, ia meminta sedekah.
Mereka menatap dia dan Petrus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Look at us.”

block.text: <<Lihatlah kepada kami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He listened to them, expecting to receive something from them.
But Peter said,

block.text: Lalu orang itu menatap mereka dengan harapan akan mendapat sesuatu dari mereka.
Tetapi Petrus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Silver and gold have I none, but what I have, that I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!”

block.text: <<Emas dan perak tidak ada padaku, tetapi apa yang kupunyai, kuberikan kepadamu: Demi nama Yesus Kristus, orang Nazaret itu, berjalanlah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took him by the right hand, and raised him up. Immediately his feet and his ankle bones received strength.

block.text: Lalu ia memegang tangan kanan orang itu dan membantu dia berdiri. Seketika itu juga kuatlah kaki dan mata kaki orang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Leaping up, he stood, and began to walk. He entered with them into the temple, walking, leaping, and praising God.

block.text: Ia melonjak berdiri lalu berjalan kian ke mari dan mengikuti mereka ke dalam Bait Allah, berjalan dan melompat-lompat serta memuji Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the people saw him walking and praising God.

block.text: Seluruh rakyat itu melihat dia berjalan sambil memuji Allah,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They recognized him. They knew that he was the crippled man who used to sit begging at the temple gate. They were filled with wonder, and they said:

block.text: lalu mereka mengenal dia sebagai orang yang biasanya duduk meminta sedekah di Gerbang Indah Bait Allah, sehingga mereka

block.characterId: people in temple courts, all the

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in temple courts, all the
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What has happened to him is truly amazing!”

block.text: takjub dan tercengang tentang apa yang telah terjadi padanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon's, greatly wondering.

block.text: Karena orang itu tetap mengikuti Petrus dan Yohanes, maka seluruh orang banyak yang sangat keheranan itu datang mengerumuni mereka di serambi yang disebut Serambi Salomo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter saw it, he responded to the people,

block.text: Petrus melihat orang banyak itu lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Israel, why do you marvel at this man? Why do you fasten your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk?

block.text: <<Hai orang Israel, mengapa kamu heran tentang kejadian itu dan mengapa kamu menatap kami seolah-olah kami membuat orang ini berjalan karena kuasa atau kesalehan kami sendiri?

ReferenceBlocks.text: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up, and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had determined to release him.

block.text: Allah Abraham, Ishak dan Yakub, Allah nenek moyang kita telah memuliakan Hamba-Nya, yaitu Yesus yang kamu serahkan dan tolak di depan Pilatus, walaupun Pilatus berpendapat, bahwa Ia harus dilepaskan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you.

block.text: Tetapi kamu telah menolak Yang Kudus dan Benar, serta menghendaki seorang pembunuh sebagai hadiahmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You killed the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, to which we are witnesses.

block.text: Demikianlah Ia, Pemimpin kepada hidup, telah kamu bunuh, tetapi Allah telah membangkitkan Dia dari antara orang mati; dan tentang hal itu kami adalah saksi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith in his name, his name has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.”

block.text: Dan karena kepercayaan dalam Nama Yesus, maka Nama itu telah menguatkan orang yang kamu lihat dan kamu kenal ini; dan kepercayaan itu telah memberi kesembuhan kepada orang ini di depan kamu semua.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now, brothers, I know that you did this in ignorance, as did also your rulers.

block.text: <<Hai saudara-saudara, aku tahu bahwa kamu telah berbuat demikian karena ketidaktahuan, sama seperti semua pemimpin kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the things which God announced by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled.”

block.text: Tetapi dengan jalan demikian Allah telah menggenapi apa yang telah difirmankan-Nya dahulu dengan perantaraan nabi-nabi-Nya, yaitu bahwa Mesias yang diutus-Nya harus menderita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Repent therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out, so that there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord,
and that he may send Christ Jesus, who was ordained for you before.

block.text: Karena itu sadarlah dan bertobatlah, supaya dosamu dihapuskan,
agar Tuhan mendatangkan waktu kelegaan, dan mengutus Yesus, yang dari semula diuntukkan bagimu sebagai Kristus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But for awhile, he must remain in heaven, until the times of restoration of all things, which God spoke long ago by the mouth of his holy prophets.

block.text: <<Kristus itu harus tinggal di sorga sampai waktu pemulihan segala sesuatu, seperti yang difirmankan Allah dengan perantaraan nabi-nabi-Nya yang kudus di zaman dahulu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Moses indeed said to the fathers, ‘The Lord God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him in all things whatever he says to you.

block.text: Bukankah telah dikatakan Musa: <Tuhan Allah akan membangkitkan bagimu seorang nabi dari antara saudara-saudaramu, sama seperti aku: Dengarkanlah dia dalam segala sesuatu yang akan dikatakannya kepadamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It will be, that every soul that will not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people.’

block.text: Dan akan terjadi, bahwa semua orang yang tidak mendengarkan nabi itu, akan dibasmi dari umat kita.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yes, and all the prophets from Samuel and those who followed after, as many as have spoken, they also told of these days.

block.text: <<Dan semua nabi yang pernah berbicara, mulai dari Samuel, dan sesudah dia, telah bernubuat tentang zaman ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘In your seed will all the families of the earth be blessed.’

block.text: Kamulah yang mewarisi nubuat-nubuat itu dan mendapat bagian dalam perjanjian yang telah diadakan Allah dengan nenek moyang kita, ketika Ia berfirman kepada Abraham: <Oleh keturunanmu semua bangsa di muka bumi akan diberkati.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: God, having raised up his servant, Jesus, sent him to you first, to bless you, in turning away everyone of you from your wickedness.”

block.text: Dan bagi kamulah pertama-tama Allah membangkitkan Hamba-Nya dan mengutus-Nya kepada kamu, supaya Ia memberkati kamu dengan memimpin kamu masing-masing kembali dari segala kejahatanmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 4
As they spoke to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came to them.

block.text: Ketika Petrus dan Yohanes sedang berbicara kepada orang banyak, mereka tiba-tiba didatangi imam-imam dan kepala pengawal Bait Allah serta orang-orang Saduki.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were upset because they taught the people and proclaimed in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

block.text: Orang-orang itu sangat marah karena mereka mengajar orang banyak dan memberitakan, bahwa dalam Yesus ada kebangkitan dari antara orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They laid hands on them, and put them in custody until the next day, for it was now evening.

block.text: Mereka ditangkap dan diserahkan ke dalam tahanan sampai keesokan harinya, karena hari telah malam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But many of those who heard the word believed, and the number of the men came to be about five thousand.

block.text: Tetapi di antara orang yang mendengar ajaran itu banyak yang menjadi percaya, sehingga jumlah mereka menjadi kira-kira lima ribu orang laki-laki.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened in the morning, that their rulers, elders, and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem.

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya pemimpin-pemimpin Yahudi serta tua-tua dan ahli-ahli Taurat mengadakan sidang di Yerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.text: Annas the high priest was there, with Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and as many as were relatives of the high priest.

block.text: dengan Imam Besar Hanas dan Kayafas, Yohanes dan Aleksander dan semua orang lain yang termasuk keturunan Imam Besar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had stood them in the middle of them, they inquired,

block.text: Lalu Petrus dan Yohanes dihadapkan kepada sidang itu dan mulai diperiksa dengan pertanyaan ini:

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “By what power, or in what name, have you done this?”

block.text: <<Dengan kuasa manakah atau dalam nama siapakah kamu bertindak demikian itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them,

block.text: Maka jawab Petrus, penuh dengan Roh Kudus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,
are we being examined today concerning a good deed done to a crippled man? Are you asking by what means this man has been healed?

block.text: <<Hai pemimpin-pemimpin umat dan tua-tua,
jika kami sekarang harus diperiksa karena suatu kebajikan kepada seorang sakit dan harus menerangkan dengan kuasa manakah orang itu disembuhkan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be it known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, in him does this man stand here before you whole.

block.text: maka ketahuilah oleh kamu sekalian dan oleh seluruh umat Israel, bahwa dalam nama Yesus Kristus, orang Nazaret, yang telah kamu salibkan, tetapi yang telah dibangkitkan Allah dari antara orang mati—bahwa oleh karena Yesus itulah orang ini berdiri dengan sehat sekarang di depan kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is ‘the stone which was regarded as worthless by you, the builders, which has become the head of the corner.’

block.text: Yesus adalah <batu yang dibuang oleh tukang-tukang bangunan—yaitu kamu sendiri—namun ia telah menjadi batu penjuru.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: There is salvation in none other, for neither is there any other name under heaven, that is given among men, by which we must be saved!”

block.text: Dan keselamatan tidak ada di dalam siapapun juga selain di dalam Dia, sebab di bawah kolong langit ini tidak ada nama lain yang diberikan kepada manusia yang olehnya kita dapat diselamatkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and had perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marveled, saying:

block.text: Ketika sidang itu melihat keberanian Petrus dan Yohanes dan mengetahui, bahwa keduanya orang biasa yang tidak terpelajar, heranlah mereka; dan mereka

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “These men are disciples of Jesus!”

block.text: mengenal keduanya sebagai pengikut Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing the man who was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

block.text: Tetapi karena mereka melihat orang yang disembuhkan itu berdiri di samping kedua rasul itu, mereka tidak dapat mengatakan apa-apa untuk membantahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,
saying,

block.text: Dan setelah mereka menyuruh rasul-rasul itu meninggalkan ruang sidang, berundinglah mereka,
dan berkata:

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What shall we do to these men? Because indeed a notable miracle has been done through them, as can be plainly seen by all who dwell in Jerusalem, and we can't deny it.

block.text: <<Tindakan apakah yang harus kita ambil terhadap orang-orang ini?>> <<Sebab telah nyata kepada semua penduduk Yerusalem, bahwa mereka telah mengadakan suatu mujizat yang menyolok dan kita tidak dapat menyangkalnya.>>

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: But so that this spreads no further among the people, let's threaten them, that from now on they don't speak to anyone in this name.”

block.text: <<Tetapi supaya hal itu jangan makin luas tersiar di antara orang banyak, baiklah kita mengancam dan melarang mereka, supaya mereka jangan berbicara lagi dengan siapapun dalam nama itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They called them and commanded them, saying:

block.text: Dan setelah keduanya disuruh masuk, mereka diperintahkan,

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not preach in the name of Jesus any more!”

block.text: supaya sama sekali jangan berbicara atau mengajar lagi dalam nama Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter and John answered them,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus dan Yohanes menjawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than to God, judge for yourselves.”

block.text: <<Silakan kamu putuskan sendiri manakah yang benar di hadapan Allah: taat kepada kamu atau taat kepada Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We can't help telling the things which we saw and heard.”

block.text: <<Sebab tidak mungkin bagi kami untuk tidak berkata-kata tentang apa yang telah kami lihat dan yang telah kami dengar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding no way to punish them, because of the people; for everyone glorified God for that which was done.

block.text: Mereka semakin keras mengancam rasul-rasul itu, tetapi akhirnya melepaskan mereka juga, sebab sidang tidak melihat jalan untuk menghukum mereka karena takut akan orang banyak yang memuliakan nama Allah berhubung dengan apa yang telah terjadi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the man on whom this miracle of healing was performed was more than forty years old.

block.text: Sebab orang yang disembuhkan oleh mujizat itu sudah lebih dari empat puluh tahun umurnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being let go, they came to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.

block.text: Sesudah dilepaskan pergilah Petrus dan Yohanes kepada teman-teman mereka, lalu mereka menceriterakan segala sesuatu yang dikatakan imam-imam kepala dan tua-tua kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard it, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said,

block.text: Ketika teman-teman mereka mendengar hal itu, berserulah mereka bersama-sama kepada Allah, katanya:

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: “O Lord, you are God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and all that is in them.

block.text: <<Ya Tuhan, Engkaulah yang menjadikan langit dan bumi, laut dan segala isinya.

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: You said through the mouth of your servant, David, said, ‘Why do the nations rage, and the peoples plot a vain thing?

block.text: Dan oleh Roh Kudus dengan perantaraan hamba-Mu Daud, bapa kami, Engkau telah berfirman: <Mengapa rusuh bangsa-bangsa, mengapa suku-suku bangsa mereka-reka perkara yang sia-sia?

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: The kings of the earth take a stand, and the rulers take council together, against the Lord, and against his Christ.’”

block.text: Raja-raja dunia bersiap-siap dan para pembesar berkumpul untuk melawan Tuhan dan Yang Diurapi-Nya.> >>

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: “For truly, in this city against your holy child, Jesus, whom you anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, were gathered together.

block.text: <<Sebab sesungguhnya telah berkumpul di dalam kota ini Herodes dan Pontius Pilatus beserta bangsa-bangsa dan suku-suku bangsa Israel melawan Yesus, Hamba-Mu yang kudus, yang Engkau urapi,

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: They were to do whatever your hand and your council foreordained to happen.

block.text: untuk melaksanakan segala sesuatu yang telah Engkau tentukan dari semula oleh kuasa dan kehendak-Mu.

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: Now, Lord, look at their threats, and grant to your servants to speak your word with all boldness.

block.text: Dan sekarang, ya Tuhan, lihatlah bagaimana mereka mengancam kami dan berikanlah kepada hamba-hamba-Mu keberanian untuk memberitakan firman-Mu.

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: May you stretch out your hand to heal and show signs and wonders through the name of your holy child Jesus.”

block.text: Ulurkanlah tangan-Mu untuk menyembuhkan orang, dan adakanlah tanda-tanda dan mujizat-mujizat oleh nama Yesus, Hamba-Mu yang kudus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were gathered together. They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they spoke the word of God with boldness.

block.text: Dan ketika mereka sedang berdoa, goyanglah tempat mereka berkumpul itu dan mereka semua penuh dengan Roh Kudus, lalu mereka memberitakan firman Allah dengan berani.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude of those who believed were of one heart and soul. Not one of them claimed that anything of the things which he possessed was his own, but they had all things in common.

block.text: Adapun kumpulan orang yang telah percaya itu, mereka sehati dan sejiwa, dan tidak seorangpun yang berkata, bahwa sesuatu dari kepunyaannya adalah miliknya sendiri, tetapi segala sesuatu adalah kepunyaan mereka bersama.

ReferenceBlocks.text: With great power, the apostles gave their testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. Great grace was on them all.

block.text: Dan dengan kuasa yang besar rasul-rasul memberi kesaksian tentang kebangkitan Tuhan Yesus dan mereka semua hidup dalam kasih karunia yang melimpah-limpah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For neither was there among them any who lacked, for as many as were owners of lands or houses sold them, and brought the proceeds of the things that were sold,
and laid them at the apostles’ feet, and distribution was made to each, according as anyone had need.

block.text: Sebab tidak ada seorangpun yang berkekurangan di antara mereka; karena semua orang yang mempunyai tanah atau rumah, menjual kepunyaannya itu, dan hasil penjualan itu mereka bawa
dan mereka letakkan di depan kaki rasul-rasul; lalu dibagi-bagikan kepada setiap orang sesuai dengan keperluannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Joses, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas (which is, being interpreted, Son of Encouragement), a Levite, a man of Cyprus by race,
having a field, sold it, and brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.

block.text: Demikian pula dengan Yusuf, yang oleh rasul-rasul disebut Barnabas, artinya anak penghiburan, seorang Lewi dari Siprus.
Ia menjual ladang, miliknya, lalu membawa uangnya itu dan meletakkannya di depan kaki rasul-rasul.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 5
But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira, his wife, sold a possession.

block.text: Ada seorang lain yang bernama Ananias. Ia beserta isterinya Safira menjual sebidang tanah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He kept back part of the price, his wife also being aware of it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
But Peter said,

block.text: Dengan setahu isterinya ia menahan sebagian dari hasil penjualan itu dan sebagian lain dibawa dan diletakkannya di depan kaki rasul-rasul.
Tetapi Petrus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit, and to keep back part of the price of the land?

block.text: <<Ananias, mengapa hatimu dikuasai Iblis, sehingga engkau mendustai Roh Kudus dan menahan sebagian dari hasil penjualan tanah itu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: While you kept it, didn't it remain your own? After it was sold, wasn't it in your power? How is it that you have conceived this thing in your heart? You haven't lied to men, but to God.”

block.text: Selama tanah itu tidak dijual, bukankah itu tetap kepunyaanmu, dan setelah dijual, bukankah hasilnya itu tetap dalam kuasamu? Mengapa engkau merencanakan perbuatan itu dalam hatimu? Engkau bukan mendustai manusia, tetapi mendustai Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and died. Great fear came on all who heard these things.

block.text: Ketika mendengar perkataan itu rebahlah Ananias dan putuslah nyawanya. Maka sangatlah ketakutan semua orang yang mendengar hal itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The young men arose and wrapped him up, and they carried him out and buried him.

block.text: Lalu datanglah beberapa orang muda; mereka mengapani mayat itu, mengusungnya ke luar dan pergi menguburnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: About three hours later, his wife, not knowing what had happened, came in.
Peter answered her,

block.text: Kira-kira tiga jam kemudian masuklah isteri Ananias, tetapi ia tidak tahu apa yang telah terjadi.
Kata Petrus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell me whether you sold the land for so much.”

block.text: <<Katakanlah kepadaku, dengan harga sekiankah tanah itu kamu jual?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said,

block.text: Jawab perempuan itu:

block.characterId: Sapphira, wife of Ananias of Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Sapphira, wife of Ananias of Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, for so much.”

block.text: <<Betul sekian.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter asked her,

block.text: Kata Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How is it that you have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord?

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu berdua bersepakat untuk mencobai Roh Tuhan?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out.”

block.text: Lihatlah, orang-orang yang baru mengubur suamimu berdiri di depan pintu dan mereka akan mengusung engkau juga ke luar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She fell down immediately at his feet, and died.

block.text: Lalu rebahlah perempuan itu seketika itu juga di depan kaki Petrus dan putuslah nyawanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The young men came in and found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her by her husband.

block.text: Ketika orang-orang muda itu masuk, mereka mendapati dia sudah mati, lalu mereka mengusungnya ke luar dan menguburnya di samping suaminya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great fear came on the whole assembly, and on all who heard these things.

block.text: Maka sangat ketakutanlah seluruh jemaat dan semua orang yang mendengar hal itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were done among the people. They were all with one accord in Solomon's porch.

block.text: Dan oleh rasul-rasul diadakan banyak tanda dan mujizat di antara orang banyak. Semua orang percaya selalu berkumpul di Serambi Salomo dalam persekutuan yang erat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: None of the rest dared to join them, however the people honored them.

block.text: Orang-orang lain tidak ada yang berani menggabungkan diri kepada mereka. Namun mereka sangat dihormati orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: More believers were added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and women.

block.text: Dan makin lama makin bertambahlah jumlah orang yang percaya kepada Tuhan, baik laki-laki maupun perempuan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They even carried out the sick into the streets, and laid them on cots and mattresses, so that as Peter came by, at the least his shadow might overshadow some of them.

block.text: bahkan mereka membawa orang-orang sakit ke luar, ke jalan raya, dan membaringkannya di atas balai-balai dan tilam, supaya, apabila Petrus lewat, setidak-tidaknya bayangannya mengenai salah seorang dari mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Multitudes also came together from the cities around Jerusalem, bringing sick people, and those who were tormented by unclean spirits: and they were all healed.

block.text: Dan juga orang banyak dari kota-kota di sekitar Yerusalem datang berduyun-duyun serta membawa orang-orang yang sakit dan orang-orang yang diganggu roh jahat. Dan mereka semua disembuhkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the high priest rose up, and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy.

block.text: Akhirnya mulailah Imam Besar dan pengikut-pengikutnya, yaitu orang-orang dari mazhab Saduki, bertindak sebab mereka sangat iri hati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They laid hands on the apostles and put them in public custody.

block.text: Mereka menangkap rasul-rasul itu, lalu memasukkan mereka ke dalam penjara kota.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors by night, and brought them out, and said,

block.text: Tetapi waktu malam seorang malaikat Tuhan membuka pintu-pintu penjara itu dan membawa mereka ke luar, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.”

block.text: <<Pergilah, berdirilah di Bait Allah dan beritakanlah seluruh firman hidup itu kepada orang banyak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard this, they entered into the temple about daybreak, and taught. But the high priest came, and those who were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.

block.text: Mereka mentaati pesan itu, dan menjelang pagi masuklah mereka ke dalam Bait Allah, lalu mulai mengajar di situ. Sementara itu Imam Besar dan pengikut-pengikutnya menyuruh Mahkamah Agama berkumpul, yaitu seluruh majelis tua-tua bangsa Israel, dan mereka menyuruh mengambil rasul-rasul itu dari penjara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the officers who came didn't find them in the prison. They returned and reported,

block.text: Tetapi ketika pejabat-pejabat datang ke penjara, mereka tidak menemukan rasul-rasul itu di situ. Lalu mereka kembali dan memberitahukan,
katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We found the prison shut and locked, and the guards standing before the doors, but when we opened them, we found no one inside!”

block.text: <<Kami mendapati penjara terkunci dengan sangat rapihnya dan semua pengawal ada di tempatnya di muka pintu, tetapi setelah kami membukanya, tidak seorangpun yang kami temukan di dalamnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the high priest, the captain of the temple, and the chief priests heard these words, they were very perplexed about them and wondered:

block.text: Ketika kepala pengawal Bait Allah dan imam-imam kepala mendengar laporan itu, mereka cemas dan

block.characterId: captain of the temple guard/chief priests

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: captain of the temple guard/chief priests
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What will happen now?”

block.text: bertanya apa yang telah terjadi dengan rasul-rasul itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One came and told them,

block.text: Tetapi datanglah seorang mendapatkan mereka dengan kabar:

block.characterId: person who told the guards and priests where the apostles were

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: person who told the guards and priests where the apostles were
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the men whom you put in prison are in the temple, standing and teaching the people.”

block.text: <<Lihat, orang-orang yang telah kamu masukkan ke dalam penjara, ada di dalam Bait Allah dan mereka mengajar orang banyak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the captain went with the officers, and brought them without violence, for they were afraid that the people might stone them.

block.text: Maka pergilah kepala pengawal serta orang-orangnya ke Bait Allah, lalu mengambil kedua rasul itu, tetapi tidak dengan kekerasan, karena mereka takut, kalau-kalau orang banyak melempari mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had brought them, they set them before the council. The high priest questioned them,
saying,

block.text: Mereka membawa keduanya dan menghadapkan mereka kepada Mahkamah Agama. Imam Besar mulai menanyai mereka,
katanya:

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Didn't we strictly command you not to teach in this name?

block.text: <<Dengan keras kami melarang kamu mengajar dalam Nama itu.

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)
ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and intend to bring this man's blood on us.”

block.text: Namun ternyata, kamu telah memenuhi Yerusalem dengan ajaranmu dan kamu hendak menanggungkan darah Orang itu kepada kami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter and the apostles answered,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus dan rasul-rasul itu menjawab, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We must obey God rather than men.

block.text: <<Kita harus lebih taat kepada Allah dari pada kepada manusia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you killed, hanging him on a tree.

block.text: Allah nenek moyang kita telah membangkitkan Yesus, yang kamu gantungkan pada kayu salib dan kamu bunuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God exalted him with his right hand to be a Prince and a Savior, to give repentance to Israel, and remission of sins.

block.text: Dialah yang telah ditinggikan oleh Allah sendiri dengan tangan kanan-Nya menjadi Pemimpin dan Juruselamat, supaya Israel dapat bertobat dan menerima pengampunan dosa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We are His witnesses of these things; and so also is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”

block.text: Dan kami adalah saksi dari segala sesuatu itu, kami dan Roh Kudus, yang dikaruniakan Allah kepada semua orang yang mentaati Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they, when they heard this, were cut to the heart, and determined to kill them.

block.text: Mendengar perkataan itu sangatlah tertusuk hati mereka dan mereka bermaksud membunuh rasul-rasul itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But one stood up in the council, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, honored by all the people, and commanded to put the apostles out for a little while.
He said to them,

block.text: Tetapi seorang Farisi dalam Mahkamah Agama itu, yang bernama Gamaliel, seorang ahli Taurat yang sangat dihormati seluruh orang banyak, bangkit dan meminta, supaya orang-orang itu disuruh keluar sebentar.
Sesudah itu ia berkata kepada sidang:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Israel, be careful concerning these men, what you are about to do.

block.text: <<Hai orang-orang Israel, pertimbangkanlah baik-baik, apa yang hendak kamu perbuat terhadap orang-orang ini!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For before these days Theudas rose up, making himself out to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: He was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were dispersed, and came to nothing.

block.text: Sebab dahulu telah muncul si Teudas, yang mengaku dirinya seorang istimewa dan ia mempunyai kira-kira empat ratus orang pengikut; tetapi ia dibunuh dan cerai-berailah seluruh pengikutnya dan lenyap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After this man, Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the enrollment, and drew away some people after him. He also perished, and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered abroad.

block.text: Sesudah dia, pada waktu pendaftaran penduduk, muncullah si Yudas, seorang Galilea. Ia menyeret banyak orang dalam pemberontakannya, tetapi ia juga tewas dan cerai-berailah seluruh pengikutnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now I tell you, withdraw from these men, and leave them alone. For if this counsel or this work is of men, it will be overthrown.

block.text: Karena itu aku berkata kepadamu: Janganlah bertindak terhadap orang-orang ini. Biarkanlah mereka, sebab jika maksud dan perbuatan mereka berasal dari manusia, tentu akan lenyap,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow it, and you would be found even to be fighting against God!”

block.text: tetapi kalau berasal dari Allah, kamu tidak akan dapat melenyapkan orang-orang ini; mungkin ternyata juga nanti, bahwa kamu melawan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They agreed with him. Summoning the apostles, they beat them and commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

block.text: Mereka memanggil rasul-rasul itu, lalu menyesah mereka dan melarang mereka mengajar dalam nama Yesus. Sesudah itu mereka dilepaskan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They therefore departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for Jesus’ name.

block.text: Rasul-rasul itu meninggalkan sidang Mahkamah Agama dengan gembira, karena mereka telah dianggap layak menderita penghinaan oleh karena Nama Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Every day, in the temple and at home, they never stopped teaching and preaching Jesus, the Christ.

block.text: Dan setiap hari mereka melanjutkan pengajaran mereka di Bait Allah dan di rumah-rumah orang dan memberitakan Injil tentang Yesus yang adalah Mesias.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 6
Now in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, a complaint arose from the Hellenists against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily service.

block.text: Pada masa itu, ketika jumlah murid makin bertambah, timbullah sungut-sungut di antara orang-orang Yahudi yang berbahasa Yunani terhadap orang-orang Ibrani, karena pembagian kepada janda-janda mereka diabaikan dalam pelayanan sehari-hari.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples and said,

block.text: Berhubung dengan itu kedua belas rasul itu memanggil semua murid berkumpul dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not appropriate for us to forsake the word of God and serve tables.

block.text: <<Kami tidak merasa puas, karena kami melalaikan Firman Allah untuk melayani meja.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore select from among you, brothers, seven men of good report, full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.

block.text: <<Karena itu, saudara-saudara, pilihlah tujuh orang dari antaramu, yang terkenal baik, dan yang penuh Roh dan hikmat, supaya kami mengangkat mereka untuk tugas itu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we will continue steadfastly in prayer and in the ministry of the word.”

block.text: dan supaya kami sendiri dapat memusatkan pikiran dalam doa dan pelayanan Firman.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: These words pleased the whole multitude. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolaus, a proselyte of Antioch.

block.text: Usul itu diterima baik oleh seluruh jemaat, lalu mereka memilih Stefanus, seorang yang penuh iman dan Roh Kudus, dan Filipus, Prokhorus, Nikanor, Timon, Parmenas dan Nikolaus, seorang penganut agama Yahudi dari Antiokhia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They set them before the apostles. When they had prayed, they laid their hands on them.

block.text: Mereka itu dihadapkan kepada rasul-rasul, lalu rasul-rasul itupun berdoa dan meletakkan tangan di atas mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The word of God increased and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem exceedingly. A great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.

block.text: Firman Allah makin tersebar, dan jumlah murid di Yerusalem makin bertambah banyak; juga sejumlah besar imam menyerahkan diri dan percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Stephen, full of faith and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people.

block.text: Dan Stefanus, yang penuh dengan karunia dan kuasa, mengadakan mujizat-mujizat dan tanda-tanda di antara orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some of those who were of the synagogue called “The Libertines,” and of the Cyrenians, of the Alexandrians, and of those of Cilicia and Asia arose, disputing with Stephen.

block.text: Tetapi tampillah beberapa orang dari jemaat Yahudi yang disebut jemaat orang Libertini—anggota-anggota jemaat itu adalah orang-orang dari Kirene dan dari Aleksandria—bersama dengan beberapa orang Yahudi dari Kilikia dan dari Asia. Orang-orang itu bersoal jawab dengan Stefanus,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They weren't able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke.

block.text: tetapi mereka tidak sanggup melawan hikmatnya dan Roh yang mendorong dia berbicara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they secretly induced men to say,

block.text: Lalu mereka menghasut beberapa orang untuk mengatakan:

block.characterId: Jews of Cyrene, Alexandria, Cilicia & Asia

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews of Cyrene, Alexandria, Cilicia & Asia
ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”

block.text: <<Kami telah mendengar dia mengucapkan kata-kata hujat terhadap Musa dan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes. Then they came against Stephen and seized him, and brought him in to the council.

block.text: Dengan jalan demikian mereka mengadakan suatu gerakan di antara orang banyak serta tua-tua dan ahli-ahli Taurat; mereka menyergap Stefanus, menyeretnya dan membawanya ke hadapan Mahkamah Agama.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They set up false witnesses who said,

block.text: Lalu mereka memajukan saksi-saksi palsu yang berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man never stops speaking blasphemous words against this holy place and the law.

block.text: <<Orang ini terus-menerus mengucapkan perkataan yang menghina tempat kudus ini dan hukum Taurat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place, and will change the customs which Moses delivered to us.”

block.text: sebab kami telah mendengar dia mengatakan, bahwa Yesus, orang Nazaret itu, akan merubuhkan tempat ini dan mengubah adat istiadat yang diwariskan oleh Musa kepada kita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: All who sat in the council, fastening their eyes on him, saw his face like it was the face of an angel.

block.text: Semua orang yang duduk dalam sidang Mahkamah Agama itu menatap Stefanus, lalu mereka melihat muka Stefanus sama seperti muka seorang malaikat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 7
The high priest said,

block.text: Kata Imam Besar:

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are these things so?”

block.text: <<Benarkah demikian?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawab Stefanus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran.

block.text: <<Hai saudara-saudara dan bapa-bapa, dengarkanlah! Allah yang Mahamulia telah menampakkan diri-Nya kepada bapa leluhur kita Abraham, ketika ia masih di Mesopotamia, sebelum ia menetap di Haran.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God said to him, ‘Get out of your land, and from your relatives, and come into a land which I will show you.’

block.text: Allah berfirman kepadanya: <Keluarlah dari negerimu dan dari sanak saudaramu dan pergilah ke negeri yang akan Kutunjukkan kepadamu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he came out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and lived in Haran. From there, when his father was dead, God moved him into this land, where you are now living.

block.text: Maka keluarlah ia dari negeri orang Kasdim, lalu menetap di Haran. Dan setelah ayahnya meninggal, Allah menyuruh dia pindah dari situ ke tanah ini, tempat kamu diam sekarang;

ReferenceBlocks.text: He gave him no inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on. God promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when he still had no child.

block.text: dan di situ Allah tidak memberikan milik pusaka kepadanya, bahkan setapak tanahpun tidak, tetapi Ia berjanji akan memberikan tanah itu kepadanya menjadi kepunyaannya dan kepunyaan keturunannya, walaupun pada waktu itu ia tidak mempunyai anak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: God spoke in this way: that his seed would live as aliens in a strange land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.

block.text: <<Beginilah firman Allah, yaitu <bahwa keturunannya akan menjadi pendatang di negeri asing dan bahwa mereka akan diperbudak dan dianiaya empat ratus tahun lamanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘I will judge the nation to which they will be in bondage,’ said God, ‘and after that will they come out, and serve me in this place.’

block.text: Tetapi bangsa yang akan memperbudak mereka itu akan Kuhukum, firman Allah, dan sesudah itu mereka akan keluar dari situ dan beribadah kepada-Ku di tempat ini.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He gave him the covenant of circumcision. So Abraham became the father of Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.”

block.text: Lalu Allah memberikan kepadanya perjanjian sunat; dan demikianlah Abraham memperanakkan Ishak, lalu menyunatkannya pada hari yang kedelapan; dan Ishak memperanakkan Yakub, dan Yakub memperanakkan kedua belas bapa leluhur kita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The patriarchs, moved with jealousy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. God was with him

block.text: <<Karena iri hati, bapa-bapa leluhur kita menjual Yusuf ke tanah Mesir, tetapi Allah menyertai dia,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He delivered him out of all his afflictions and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt. He made him governor over Egypt and all his house.

block.text: dan melepaskannya dari segala penindasan serta menganugerahkan kepadanya kasih karunia dan hikmat, ketika ia menghadap Firaun, raja Mesir. Firaun mengangkatnya menjadi kuasa atas tanah Mesir dan atas seluruh istananya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now a famine came over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction. Our fathers found no food.

block.text: <<Maka datanglah bahaya kelaparan menimpa seluruh tanah Mesir dan tanah Kanaan serta penderitaan yang besar, sehingga nenek moyang kita tidak mendapat makanan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers the first time.

block.text: Tetapi ketika Yakub mendengar, bahwa di tanah Mesir ada gandum, ia menyuruh nenek moyang kita ke sana. Itulah kunjungan mereka yang pertama;

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph's race was revealed to Pharaoh.

block.text: pada kunjungan mereka yang kedua Yusuf memperkenalkan dirinya kepada saudara-saudaranya, lalu ketahuanlah asal-usul Yusuf kepada Firaun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Joseph sent, and summoned Jacob, his father, and all his relatives, seventy-five souls.

block.text: Kemudian Yusuf menyuruh menjemput Yakub, ayahnya, dan semua sanak saudaranya, tujuh puluh lima jiwa banyaknya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jacob went down into Egypt, and he died. Our forefathers died there also.

block.text: Lalu pergilah Yakub ke tanah Mesir. Di situ ia meninggal, ia dan nenek moyang kita;

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all brought back to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in silver from the children of Hamor of Shechem.”

block.text: mayat mereka dipindahkan ke Sikhem dan diletakkan di dalam kuburan yang telah dibeli Abraham dengan sejumlah uang perak dari anak-anak Hemor di Sikhem.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But as the time of the promise came close which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt.

block.text: <<Tetapi makin dekat genapnya janji yang diberikan Allah kepada Abraham, makin bertambah banyaklah bangsa itu di Mesir,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then there arose a different king, who didn't know Joseph.

block.text: sampai bangkit seorang raja lain memerintah tanah Mesir, seorang yang tidak mengenal Yusuf.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same took advantage of our race, and mistreated our fathers, and forced them to throw out their babies, so that they wouldn't stay alive.

block.text: Raja itu mempergunakan tipu daya terhadap bangsa kita dan menganiaya nenek moyang kita serta menyuruh membuang bayi mereka, supaya bangsa kita itu jangan berkembang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At that time Moses was born, and was exceedingly handsome. He was nourished three months in his father's house.

block.text: Pada waktu itulah Musa lahir dan ia elok di mata Allah. Tiga bulan lamanya ia diasuh di rumah ayahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he was thrown out, Pharaoh's daughter took him up, and reared him as her own son.

block.text: Lalu ia dibuang, tetapi puteri Firaun memungutnya dan menyuruh mengasuhnya seperti anaknya sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians. He was mighty in his words and works.

block.text: Dan Musa dididik dalam segala hikmat orang Mesir, dan ia berkuasa dalam perkataan dan perbuatannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brothers, the children of Israel.

block.text: <<Pada waktu ia berumur empat puluh tahun, timbullah keinginan dalam hatinya untuk mengunjungi saudara-saudaranya, yaitu orang-orang Israel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged him who was oppressed, striking the Egyptian.

block.text: Ketika itu ia melihat seorang dianiaya oleh seorang Mesir, lalu ia menolong dan membela orang itu dengan membunuh orang Mesir itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He supposed that his brothers understood that God, by his hand, was giving them deliverance; but they didn't understand.”

block.text: Pada sangkanya saudara-saudaranya akan mengerti, bahwa Allah memakai dia untuk menyelamatkan mereka, tetapi mereka tidak mengerti.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The day following, he appeared to them as they fought, and urged them to be at peace again, saying, ‘Sirs, you are brothers. Why do you wrong one another?’

block.text: <<Pada keesokan harinya ia muncul pula ketika dua orang Israel sedang berkelahi, lalu ia berusaha mendamaikan mereka, katanya: <Saudara-saudara! Bukankah kamu ini bersaudara? Mengapakah kamu saling menganiaya?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who did his neighbor wrong pushed him away, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?

block.text: Tetapi orang yang berbuat salah kepada temannya itu menolak Musa dan berkata: <Siapakah yang mengangkat engkau menjadi pemimpin dan hakim atas kami?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Do you want to kill me, as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’

block.text: Apakah engkau bermaksud membunuh aku, sama seperti kemarin engkau membunuh orang Mesir itu?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moses fled at this saying, and became a stranger in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.”

block.text: Mendengar perkataan itu, larilah Musa dan hidup sebagai pendatang di tanah Midian. Di situ ia memperanakkan dua orang anak laki-laki.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When forty years were fulfilled, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.

block.text: <<Dan sesudah empat puluh tahun tampaklah kepadanya seorang malaikat di padang gurun gunung Sinai di dalam nyala api yang keluar dari semak duri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight. As he came close to see, a voice of the Lord came to him and said:

block.text: Musa heran tentang penglihatan itu, dan ketika ia pergi ke situ untuk melihatnya dari dekat, datanglah suara Tuhan kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’ Moses trembled, and dared not look.

block.text: <Akulah Allah nenek moyangmu, Allah Abraham, Ishak dan Yakub.> Maka gemetarlah Musa, dan ia tidak berani lagi melihatnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said to him, ‘Take your sandals off of your feet, for the place where you stand is holy ground.

block.text: <<Lalu firman Allah kepadanya: <Tanggalkanlah kasutmu dari kakimu, sebab tempat, di mana engkau berdiri itu, adalah tanah yang kudus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have surely seen the affliction of my people that is in Egypt, and have heard their groaning. I have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you into Egypt.’”

block.text: Aku telah memperhatikan dengan sungguh kesengsaraan umat-Ku di tanah Mesir dan Aku telah mendengar keluh kesah mereka, dan Aku telah turun untuk melepaskan mereka; karena itu marilah, engkau akan Kuutus ke tanah Mesir.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This Moses, whom they refused, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge?’--God has sent him as both a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.

block.text: <<Musa ini, yang telah mereka tolak, dengan mengatakan: <Siapakah yang mengangkat engkau menjadi pemimpin dan hakim?> —Musa ini juga telah diutus oleh Allah sebagai pemimpin dan penyelamat oleh malaikat, yang telah menampakkan diri kepadanya di semak duri itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This man led them out, having worked wonders and signs in Egypt, in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.

block.text: Dialah yang membawa mereka keluar dengan mengadakan mujizat-mujizat dan tanda-tanda di tanah Mesir, di Laut Merah dan di padang gurun, empat puluh tahun lamanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is that Moses, who said to the children of Israel, ‘The Lord our God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me; him shall you hear’

block.text: <<Musa ini pulalah yang berkata kepada orang Israel: <Seorang nabi seperti aku ini akan dibangkitkan Allah bagimu dari antara saudara-saudaramu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is he who was in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel that spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, who received living oracles to give to us.

block.text: Musa inilah yang menjadi pengantara dalam sidang jemaah di padang gurun di antara malaikat yang berfirman kepadanya di gunung Sinai dan nenek moyang kita; dan dialah yang menerima firman-firman yang hidup untuk menyampaikannya kepada kamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Our forefathers would not listen to him but rejected him, and turned back in their hearts to Egypt.

block.text: <<Tetapi nenek moyang kita tidak mau taat kepadanya, malahan mereka menolaknya. Dalam hati mereka ingin kembali ke tanah Mesir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to Aaron, ‘Make us gods that will go before us, for as for this Moses, who led us out of the land of Egypt, we don't know what has become of him.’

block.text: Kepada Harun mereka berkata: <Buatlah untuk kami beberapa allah yang akan berjalan di depan kami, sebab Musa ini yang telah memimpin kami keluar dari tanah Mesir—kami tidak tahu apa yang telah terjadi dengan dia.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They made a calf in those days, and brought a sacrifice to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their hands.

block.text: Lalu pada waktu itu mereka membuat sebuah anak lembu dan mempersembahkan persembahan kepada berhala itu dan mereka bersukacita tentang apa yang dibuat sendiri oleh mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But God turned, and gave them up to serve the army of the sky, as it is written in the book of the prophets, ‘Did you offer to me slain animals and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?

block.text: <<Maka berpalinglah Allah dari mereka dan membiarkan mereka beribadah kepada bala tentara langit, seperti yang tertulis dalam kitab nabi-nabi: <Apakah kamu mempersembahkan kepada-Ku korban sembelihan dan persembahan selama empat puluh tahun di padang gurun itu, hai kaum Israel?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You took up the tabernacle of Moloch, the star of your god Rephan, the figures which you made to worship. I will carry you away beyond Babylon.’”

block.text: Tidak pernah, malahan kamu mengusung kemah Molokh dan bintang dewa Refan, patung-patung yang kamu buat itu untuk disembah. Maka Aku akan membawa kamu ke dalam pembuangan, sampai di seberang sana Babel.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Our fathers had the tabernacle of the testimony in the wilderness, even as he who spoke to Moses commanded him to make it according to the pattern that he had seen.

block.text: <<Kemah Kesaksian ada pada nenek moyang kita di padang gurun, seperti yang diperintahkan Allah kepada Musa untuk membuatnya menurut contoh yang telah dilihatnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having received the tabernacle, our fathers, under Joshua, brought it with them when they entered into the possession of the nations, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers, to the days of David.

block.text: Kemah itu yang diterima nenek moyang kita dan yang dengan pimpinan Yosua dibawa masuk ke tanah ini, yaitu waktu tanah ini direbut dari bangsa-bangsa lain yang dihalau Allah dari depan nenek moyang kita; demikianlah sampai kepada zaman Daud.

ReferenceBlocks.text: David found favor in the sight of God and asked to find a habitation for the God of Jacob.

block.text: Daud telah mendapat kasih karunia di hadapan Allah dan ia memohon, supaya ia diperkenankan untuk mendirikan suatu tempat kediaman bagi Allah Yakub.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Solomon built him a house.
