block.text: Tetapi Salomolah yang mendirikan sebuah rumah untuk Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, the Most High doesn't dwell in temples made with hands: The prophet says:

block.text: <<Tetapi Yang Mahatinggi tidak diam di dalam apa yang dibuat oleh tangan manusia, seperti yang dikatakan oleh nabi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘heaven is my throne, and the earth a footstool for my feet. What kind of house will you build me?’ says the Lord; ‘or what is the place of my rest?

block.text: <Langit adalah takhta-Ku, dan bumi adalah tumpuan kaki-Ku. Rumah apakah yang akan kamu dirikan bagi-Ku, demikian firman Tuhan, tempat apakah yang akan menjadi perhentian-Ku?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Didn't my hand make all these things?’”

block.text: Bukankah tangan-Ku sendiri yang membuat semuanya ini?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, you always resist the Holy Spirit! As your fathers did, so you do.

block.text: Hai orang-orang yang keras kepala dan yang tidak bersunat hati dan telinga, kamu selalu menentang Roh Kudus, sama seperti nenek moyangmu, demikian juga kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which of the prophets didn't your fathers persecute? They killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One, of whom you have now become betrayers and murderers.

block.text: Siapakah dari nabi-nabi yang tidak dianiaya oleh nenek moyangmu? Bahkan mereka membunuh orang-orang yang lebih dahulu memberitakan tentang kedatangan Orang Benar, yang sekarang telah kamu khianati dan kamu bunuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You received the law as it was ordained by angels, and didn't keep it!”

block.text: Kamu telah menerima hukum Taurat yang disampaikan oleh malaikat-malaikat, akan tetapi kamu tidak menurutinya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed at him with their teeth.

block.text: Ketika anggota-anggota Mahkamah Agama itu mendengar semuanya itu, sangat tertusuk hati mereka. Maka mereka menyambutnya dengan gertakan gigi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked up steadfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,
and said,

block.text: Tetapi Stefanus, yang penuh dengan Roh Kudus, menatap ke langit, lalu melihat kemuliaan Allah dan Yesus berdiri di sebelah kanan Allah.
Lalu katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!”

block.text: <<Sungguh, aku melihat langit terbuka dan Anak Manusia berdiri di sebelah kanan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and rushed at him with one accord.

block.text: Maka berteriak-teriaklah mereka dan sambil menutup telinga serentak menyerbu dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They threw him out of the city, and stoned him. The witnesses placed their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.

block.text: Mereka menyeret dia ke luar kota, lalu melemparinya. Dan saksi-saksi meletakkan jubah mereka di depan kaki seorang muda yang bernama Saulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They stoned Stephen as he called out, saying,

block.text: Sedang mereka melemparinya Stefanus berdoa, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”

block.text: <<Ya Tuhan Yesus, terimalah rohku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice,

block.text: Sambil berlutut ia berseru dengan suara nyaring:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, don't hold this sin against them!”

block.text: <<Tuhan, janganlah tanggungkan dosa ini kepada mereka!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he fell asleep.

block.text: Dan dengan perkataan itu meninggallah ia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 8

Saul was consenting to his death. A great persecution arose against the assembly which was in Jerusalem in that day. They were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except for the apostles.

block.text: Saulus juga setuju, bahwa Stefanus mati dibunuh. Pada waktu itu mulailah penganiayaan yang hebat terhadap jemaat di Yerusalem. Mereka semua, kecuali rasul-rasul, tersebar ke seluruh daerah Yudea dan Samaria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Devout men buried Stephen, and lamented greatly over him.

block.text: Orang-orang saleh menguburkan mayat Stefanus serta meratapinya dengan sangat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Saul ravaged the assembly, entering into every house, and dragged both men and women off to prison.

block.text: Tetapi Saulus berusaha membinasakan jemaat itu dan ia memasuki rumah demi rumah dan menyeret laki-laki dan perempuan ke luar dan menyerahkan mereka untuk dimasukkan ke dalam penjara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore those who were scattered abroad went around preaching the word.

block.text: Mereka yang tersebar itu menjelajah seluruh negeri itu sambil memberitakan Injil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and proclaimed to them the Christ.

block.text: Dan Filipus pergi ke suatu kota di Samaria dan memberitakan Mesias kepada orang-orang di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitudes listened with one accord to the things that were spoken by Philip, when they heard and saw the signs which he did.

block.text: Ketika orang banyak itu mendengar pemberitaan Filipus dan melihat tanda-tanda yang diadakannya, mereka semua dengan bulat hati menerima apa yang diberitakannya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For unclean spirits came out of many of those who had them. They came out, crying with a loud voice. Many who had been paralyzed and lame were healed.

block.text: Sebab dari banyak orang yang kerasukan roh jahat keluarlah roh-roh itu sambil berseru dengan suara keras, dan banyak juga orang lumpuh dan orang timpang yang disembuhkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There was great joy in that city.

block.text: Maka sangatlah besar sukacita dalam kota itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there was a certain man, Simon by name, who used to practice sorcery in the city, and amazed the people of Samaria, making himself out to be some great one.

block.text: Seorang yang bernama Simon telah sejak dahulu melakukan sihir di kota itu dan mentakjubkan rakyat Samaria, serta berlagak seolah-olah ia seorang yang sangat penting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone listened to him, from the least to the greatest, saying,

block.text: Semua orang, besar kecil, mengikuti dia dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man is that great power of God.”

block.text: <<Orang ini adalah kuasa Allah yang terkenal sebagai Kuasa Besar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They listened to him, because for a long time he had amazed them with his sorceries.

block.text: Dan mereka mengikutinya, karena sudah lama ia mentakjubkan mereka oleh perbuatan sihirnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they believed Philip preaching good news concerning the Kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

block.text: Tetapi sekarang mereka percaya kepada Filipus yang memberitakan Injil tentang Kerajaan Allah dan tentang nama Yesus Kristus, dan mereka memberi diri mereka dibaptis, baik laki-laki maupun perempuan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon himself also believed. Being baptized, he continued with Philip. Seeing signs and great miracles occurring, he was amazed.

block.text: Simon sendiri juga menjadi percaya, dan sesudah dibaptis, ia senantiasa bersama-sama dengan Filipus, dan takjub ketika ia melihat tanda-tanda dan mujizat-mujizat besar yang terjadi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.

block.text: Ketika rasul-rasul di Yerusalem mendengar, bahwa tanah Samaria telah menerima firman Allah, mereka mengutus Petrus dan Yohanes ke situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they arrived, they prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Setibanya di situ kedua rasul itu berdoa, supaya orang-orang Samaria itu beroleh Roh Kudus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He had not yet fallen on none of them. They had only been baptized in the name of Christ Jesus.

block.text: Sebab Roh Kudus belum turun di atas seorangpun di antara mereka, karena mereka hanya dibaptis dalam nama Tuhan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Kemudian keduanya menumpangkan tangan di atas mereka, lalu mereka menerima Roh Kudus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money,
saying,

block.text: Ketika Simon melihat, bahwa pemberian Roh Kudus terjadi oleh karena rasul-rasul itu menumpangkan tangannya, ia menawarkan uang kepada mereka,
serta berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give me also this power, that whomever I lay my hands on may receive the Holy Spirit.”

block.text: <<Berikanlah juga kepadaku kuasa itu, supaya jika aku menumpangkan tanganku di atas seseorang, ia boleh menerima Roh Kudus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter said to him,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!

block.text: <<Binasalah kiranya uangmu itu bersama dengan engkau, karena engkau menyangka, bahwa engkau dapat membeli karunia Allah dengan uang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have neither part nor lot in this matter, for your heart isn't right before God.

block.text: Tidak ada bagian atau hakmu dalam perkara ini, sebab hatimu tidak lurus di hadapan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Repent therefore of this, your wickedness, and ask God if perhaps the thought of your heart may be forgiven you.

block.text: Jadi bertobatlah dari kejahatanmu ini dan berdoalah kepada Tuhan, supaya Ia mengampuni niat hatimu ini;

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bondage of iniquity.”

block.text: sebab kulihat, bahwa hatimu telah seperti empedu yang pahit dan terjerat dalam kejahatan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon answered,

block.text: Jawab Simon:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Pray for me to the Lord, that none of the things which you have spoken happen to me.”

block.text: <<Hendaklah kamu berdoa untuk aku kepada Tuhan, supaya kepadaku jangan kiranya terjadi segala apa yang telah kamu katakan itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They therefore, when they had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the Good News to many villages of the Samaritans.

block.text: Setelah keduanya bersaksi dan memberitakan firman Tuhan, kembalilah mereka ke Yerusalem dan dalam perjalanannya itu mereka memberitakan Injil dalam banyak kampung di Samaria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying,

block.text: Kemudian berkatalah seorang malaikat Tuhan kepada Filipus, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise, and go toward the south to the way that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza. This is a desert.”

block.text: <<Bangunlah dan berangkatlah ke sebelah selatan, menurut jalan yang turun dari Yerusalem ke Gaza.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose and went; and behold, there was a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem to worship.

block.text: Jalan itu jalan yang sunyi.
Lalu berangkatlah Filipus. Adalah seorang Etiopia, seorang sida-sida, pembesar dan kepala perbendaharaan Sri Kandake, ratu negeri Etiopia, yang pergi ke Yerusalem untuk beribadah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was returning and sitting in his chariot, and was reading the prophet Isaiah.
The Spirit said to Philip,

block.text: Sekarang orang itu sedang dalam perjalanan pulang dan duduk dalam keretanya sambil membaca kitab nabi Yesaya.
Lalu kata Roh kepada Filipus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go near, and join yourself to this chariot.”

block.text: <<Pergilah ke situ dan dekatilah kereta itu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip ran to him, and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet, and said,

block.text: Filipus segera ke situ dan mendengar sida-sida itu sedang membaca kitab nabi Yesaya. Kata Filipus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you understand what you are reading?”

block.text: <<Mengertikah tuan apa yang tuan baca itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can I, unless someone explains it to me?”

block.text: <<Bagaimanakah aku dapat mengerti, kalau tidak ada yang membimbing aku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He begged Philip to come up and sit with him.

block.text: Lalu ia meminta Filipus naik dan duduk di sampingnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the passage of the Scripture which he was reading was this,

block.text: Nas yang dibacanya itu berbunyi seperti berikut:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He was led as a sheep to the slaughter. As a lamb before his shearer is silent, so he doesn't open his mouth.

block.text: <<Seperti seekor domba Ia dibawa ke pembantaian; dan seperti anak domba yang kelu di depan orang yang menggunting bulunya, demikianlah Ia tidak membuka mulut-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In his humiliation, his judgment was taken away. Who will declare His generation? For his life is taken from the earth.”

block.text: Dalam kehinaan-Nya berlangsunglah hukuman-Nya; siapakah yang akan menceriterakan asal-usul-Nya? Sebab nyawa-Nya diambil dari bumi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The eunuch answered Philip,

block.text: Maka kata sida-sida itu kepada Filipus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is the prophet talking about? About himself, or about someone else?”

block.text: <<Aku bertanya kepadamu, tentang siapakah nabi berkata demikian? Tentang dirinya sendiri atau tentang orang lain?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this Scripture, preached to him Jesus.

block.text: Maka mulailah Filipus berbicara dan bertolak dari nas itu ia memberitakan Injil Yesus kepadanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they went on the way, they came to some water, and the eunuch said,

block.text: Mereka melanjutkan perjalanan mereka, dan tiba di suatu tempat yang ada air. Lalu kata sida-sida itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, here is water. What is keeping me from being baptized?”

block.text: <<Lihat, di situ ada air; apakah halangannya, jika aku dibaptis?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: And Philip said,

block.text: (Sahut Filipus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you believe with all your heart, you may”.

block.text: <<Jika tuan percaya dengan segenap hati, boleh.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he answered and said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God”.

block.text: <<Aku percaya, bahwa Yesus Kristus adalah Anak Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the chariot to stand still, and they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.

block.text: Lalu orang Etiopia itu menyuruh menghentikan kereta itu, dan keduanya turun ke dalam air, baik Filipus maupun sida-sida itu, dan Filipus membaptis dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught Philip away, and the eunuch didn't see him any more, for he went on his way rejoicing.

block.text: Dan setelah mereka keluar dari air, Roh Tuhan tiba-tiba melarikan Filipus dan sida-sida itu tidak melihatnya lagi. Ia meneruskan perjalanannya dengan sukacita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Philip was found at Azotus. Passing through, he preached the Good News to all the cities, until he came to Caesarea.

block.text: Tetapi ternyata Filipus ada di Asdod. Ia berjalan melalui daerah itu dan memberitakan Injil di semua kota sampai ia tiba di Kaisarea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 9
But Saul was still breathing threats and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord.

block.text: Sementara itu berkobar-kobar hati Saulus untuk mengancam dan membunuh murid-murid Tuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went to the high priest,
and asked for letters from him to the synagogues of Damascus, that if he found any who were of the Way, whether men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.

block.text: Ia menghadap Imam Besar,

dan meminta surat kuasa dari padanya untuk dibawa kepada majelis-majelis Yahudi di Damsyik, supaya, jika ia menemukan laki-laki atau perempuan yang mengikuti Jalan Tuhan, ia menangkap mereka dan membawa mereka ke Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he traveled, it happened that he got close to Damascus, and suddenly a light from the sky shone around him.

block.text: Dalam perjalanannya ke Damsyik, ketika ia sudah dekat kota itu, tiba-tiba cahaya memancar dari langit mengelilingi dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He fell on the earth, and heard a voice saying to him,

block.text: Ia rebah ke tanah dan kedengaranlah olehnya suatu suara yang berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me?”

block.text: <<Saulus, Saulus, mengapakah engkau menganiaya Aku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawab Saulus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are you, Lord?”

block.text: <<Siapakah Engkau, Tuhan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: Kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting: it is hard for you to kick against the goads.”

block.text: <<Akulah Yesus yang kauaniaya itu. Sulit bagi Anda untuk menendang goads. "

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he trembling and astonished said,

block.text: Dan ia gemetar dan heran berkata,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, what should I do?”

block.text: "Tuhan, apa yang harus saya lakukan?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: And the Lord said to him,

block.text: Yesus menjawab,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rise up, and enter into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”

block.text: "Bangunlah, dan masuk ke dalam kota, dan Anda akan diberitahu apa yang harus Anda lakukan."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men who traveled with him stood speechless, hearing the sound, but seeing no one.

block.text: Maka termangu-mangulah teman-temannya seperjalanan, karena mereka memang mendengar suara itu, tetapi tidak melihat seorang jugapun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Saul arose from the ground, and when his eyes were opened, he saw no one. They led him by the hand, and brought him into Damascus.

block.text: Saulus bangun dan berdiri, lalu membuka matanya, tetapi ia tidak dapat melihat apa-apa; mereka harus menuntun dia masuk ke Damsyik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was without sight for three days, and neither ate nor drank.

block.text: Tiga hari lamanya ia tidak dapat melihat dan tiga hari lamanya ia tidak makan dan minum.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus named Ananias. The Lord said to him in a vision,

block.text: Di Damsyik ada seorang murid Tuhan bernama Ananias. Firman Tuhan kepadanya dalam suatu penglihatan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ananias!”

block.text: <<Ananias!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, it's me, Lord.”

block.text: <<Ini aku, Tuhan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said to him,

block.text: Firman Tuhan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise, and go to the street which is called Straight, and inquire in the house of Judah for one named Saul, a man of Tarsus. For behold, he is praying.

block.text: <<Mari, pergilah ke jalan yang bernama Jalan Lurus, dan carilah di rumah Yudas seorang dari Tarsus yang bernama Saulus. Ia sekarang berdoa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias coming in, and laying his hands on him, that he might receive his sight.”

block.text: Dalam suatu penglihatan ia melihat, bahwa seorang yang bernama Ananias masuk ke dalam dan menumpangkan tangannya ke atasnya, supaya ia dapat melihat lagi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Ananias answered,

block.text: Jawab Ananias:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how much evil he did to your saints at Jerusalem.

block.text: <<Tuhan, dari banyak orang telah kudengar tentang orang itu, betapa banyaknya kejahatan yang dilakukannya terhadap orang-orang kudus-Mu di Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on your name.”

block.text: Dan ia datang ke mari dengan kuasa penuh dari imam-imam kepala untuk menangkap semua orang yang memanggil nama-Mu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Lord said to him,

block.text: Tetapi firman Tuhan kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way, for he is my chosen vessel to bear my name before the nations and kings, and the children of Israel.

block.text: <<Pergilah, sebab orang ini adalah alat pilihan bagi-Ku untuk memberitakan nama-Ku kepada bangsa-bangsa lain serta raja-raja dan orang-orang Israel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I will show him how many things he must suffer for my name's sake.”

block.text: Aku sendiri akan menunjukkan kepadanya, betapa banyak penderitaan yang harus ia tanggung oleh karena nama-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ananias departed, and entered into the house. Laying his hands on him, he said,

block.text: Lalu pergilah Ananias ke situ dan masuk ke rumah itu. Ia menumpangkan tangannya ke atas Saulus, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brother Saul, the Lord, who appeared to you on the road by which you came, has sent me, that you may receive your sight, and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”

block.text: <<Saulus, saudaraku, Tuhan Yesus, yang telah menampakkan diri kepadamu di jalan yang engkau lalui, telah menyuruh aku kepadamu, supaya engkau dapat melihat lagi dan penuh dengan Roh Kudus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he received his sight. He arose and was baptized.

block.text: Dan seketika itu juga seolah-olah selaput gugur dari matanya, sehingga ia dapat melihat lagi. Ia bangun lalu dibaptis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took food and was strengthened. Saul stayed several days with the disciples who were at Damascus.

block.text: Dan setelah ia makan, pulihlah kekuatannya. Saulus tinggal beberapa hari bersama-sama dengan murid-murid di Damsyik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately in the synagogues he proclaimed the Christ, that he is the Son of God.

block.text: Ketika itu juga ia memberitakan Yesus di rumah-rumah ibadat, dan mengatakan bahwa Yesus adalah Anak Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All who heard him were amazed, and said,

block.text: Semua orang yang mendengar hal itu heran dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't this he who in Jerusalem made havoc of those who called on this name? And he had come here intending to bring them bound before the chief priests!”

block.text: <<Bukankah dia ini yang di Yerusalem mau membinasakan barangsiapa yang memanggil nama Yesus ini? Dan bukankah ia datang ke sini dengan maksud untuk menangkap dan membawa mereka ke hadapan imam-imam kepala?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Saul increased more in strength, and confounded the Jews who lived at Damascus, proving that this is the Christ.

block.text: Akan tetapi Saulus semakin besar pengaruhnya dan ia membingungkan orang-orang Yahudi yang tinggal di Damsyik, karena ia membuktikan, bahwa Yesus adalah Mesias.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When many days were fulfilled, the Jews conspired together to kill him.

block.text: Beberapa hari kemudian orang Yahudi merundingkan suatu rencana untuk membunuh Saulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, their plot became known to Saul. They watched the gates both day and night that they might kill him.

block.text: Tetapi maksud jahat itu diketahui oleh Saulus. Siang malam orang-orang Yahudi mengawal semua pintu gerbang kota, supaya dapat membunuh dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, his disciples took him by night, and let him down through the wall, lowering him in a basket.

block.text: Sungguhpun demikian pada suatu malam murid-muridnya mengambilnya dan menurunkannya dari atas tembok kota dalam sebuah keranjang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Saul had come to Jerusalem, he tried to join himself to the disciples; but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.

block.text: Setibanya di Yerusalem Saulus mencoba menggabungkan diri kepada murid-murid, tetapi semuanya takut kepadanya, karena mereka tidak dapat percaya, bahwa ia juga seorang murid.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles and declared to them:

block.text: Tetapi Barnabas menerima dia dan membawanya kepada rasul-rasul dan menceriterakan kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He saw and spoke to the Lord while he was on the road, and he preached boldly at Damascas in the Name of the Lord.”

block.text: bagaimana Saulus melihat Tuhan di tengah jalan dan bahwa Tuhan berbicara dengan dia dan bagaimana keberaniannya mengajar di Damsyik dalam nama Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was with them entering into Jerusalem.

block.text: Dan Saulus tetap bersama-sama dengan mereka di Yerusalem, dan dengan keberanian mengajar dalam nama Tuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He preached boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus. He spoke and disputed against the Hellenists, but they were seeking to kill him.

block.text: Ia juga berbicara dan bersoal jawab dengan orang-orang Yahudi yang berbahasa Yunani, tetapi mereka itu berusaha membunuh dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the brothers knew it, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him off to Tarsus.

block.text: Akan tetapi setelah hal itu diketahui oleh saudara-saudara anggota jemaat, mereka membawa dia ke Kaisarea dan dari situ membantu dia ke Tarsus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the assemblies throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace, and were built up. They were multiplied, walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Selama beberapa waktu jemaat di seluruh Yudea, Galilea dan Samaria berada dalam keadaan damai. Jemaat itu dibangun dan hidup dalam takut akan Tuhan. Jumlahnya makin bertambah besar oleh pertolongan dan penghiburan Roh Kudus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as Peter went throughout all those parts, he came down also to the saints who lived at Lydda.

block.text: Pada waktu itu Petrus berjalan keliling, mengadakan kunjungan ke mana-mana. Dalam perjalanan itu ia singgah juga kepada orang-orang kudus yang di Lida.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There he found a certain man named Aeneas, who had been bedridden for eight years, because he was paralyzed.
Peter said to him,

block.text: Di situ didapatinya seorang bernama Eneas, yang telah delapan tahun terbaring di tempat tidur karena lumpuh.
Kata Petrus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Take up your mat and get up.!”

block.text: <<Eneas, Yesus Kristus menyembuhkan engkau; bangunlah dan bereskanlah tempat tidurmu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he arose.
All who lived at Lydda and in Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.

block.text: Seketika itu juga bangunlah orang itu.
Semua penduduk Lida dan Saron melihat dia, lalu mereka berbalik kepada Tuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which when translated, means Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and acts of mercy which she did.

block.text: Di Yope ada seorang murid perempuan bernama Tabita—dalam bahasa Yunani Dorkas. Perempuan itu banyak sekali berbuat baik dan memberi sedekah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened in those days that she fell sick, and died. When they had washed her, they laid her in an upper room.

block.text: Tetapi pada waktu itu ia sakit lalu meninggal. Dan setelah dimandikan, mayatnya dibaringkan di ruang atas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men to him, imploring him

block.text: Lida dekat dengan Yope. Ketika murid-murid mendengar, bahwa Petrus ada di Lida, mereka menyuruh dua orang kepadanya dengan permintaan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not to delay in coming.”

block.text: <<Segeralah datang ke tempat kami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter got up and went with them. When he had come, they brought him into the upper room. All the widows stood by him weeping, and showing the coats and garments which Dorcas had made while she was with them.

block.text: Maka berkemaslah Petrus dan berangkat bersama-sama dengan mereka. Setelah sampai di sana, ia dibawa ke ruang atas dan semua janda datang berdiri dekatnya dan sambil menangis mereka menunjukkan kepadanya semua baju dan pakaian, yang dibuat Dorkas waktu ia masih hidup.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter put them all out, and kneeled down and prayed. Turning to the body, he said,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus menyuruh mereka semua keluar, lalu ia berlutut dan berdoa. Kemudian ia berpaling ke mayat itu dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tabitha, get up!”

block.text: <<Tabita, bangkitlah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.

block.text: Lalu Tabita membuka matanya dan ketika melihat Petrus, ia bangun lalu duduk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He gave her his hand, and raised her up. Calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.

block.text: Petrus memegang tangannya dan membantu dia berdiri. Kemudian ia memanggil orang-orang kudus beserta janda-janda, lalu menunjukkan kepada mereka, bahwa perempuan itu hidup.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.

block.text: Peristiwa itu tersiar di seluruh Yope dan banyak orang menjadi percaya kepada Tuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, that he stayed many days in Joppa with one Simon, a tanner.

block.text: Kemudian dari pada itu Petrus tinggal beberapa hari di Yope, di rumah seorang yang bernama Simon, seorang penyamak kulit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 10
Now there was a certain man in Caesarea, Cornelius by name, a centurion of what was called the Italian Regiment.

block.text: Di Kaisarea ada seorang yang bernama Kornelius, seorang perwira pasukan yang disebut pasukan Italia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was a devout man, and one who feared God with all his house, who gave gifts for the needy generously to the people, and always prayed to God.

block.text: Ia saleh, ia serta seisi rumahnya takut akan Allah dan ia memberi banyak sedekah kepada umat Yahudi dan senantiasa berdoa kepada Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At about the ninth hour of the day, he clearly saw in a vision an angel of God coming to him, and saying to him,

block.text: Dalam suatu penglihatan, kira-kira jam tiga petang, jelas tampak kepadanya seorang malaikat Allah masuk ke rumahnya dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cornelius!”

block.text: <<Kornelius!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He, fastening his eyes on him, and being frightened, said,

block.text: Ia menatap malaikat itu dan dengan takut ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is it, Lord?”

block.text: <<Ada apa, Tuhan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jawab malaikat itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your prayers and your gifts to the needy have gone up for a memorial before God.

block.text: <<Semua doamu dan sedekahmu telah naik ke hadirat Allah dan Allah mengingat engkau.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now send men to Joppa, and get Simon, who is surnamed Peter.

block.text: Dan sekarang, suruhlah beberapa orang ke Yope untuk menjemput seorang yang bernama Simon dan yang disebut Petrus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He lodges with one Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the seaside: he will tell you what you should do..”

block.text: Ia menumpang di rumah seorang penyamak kulit yang bernama Simon, yang tinggal di tepi laut.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the angel who spoke to him had departed, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier of those who waited on him continually.

block.text: Setelah malaikat yang berbicara kepadanya itu meninggalkan dia, dipanggilnya dua orang hambanya beserta seorang prajurit yang saleh dari orang-orang yang selalu bersama-sama dengan dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having explained everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.

block.text: Dan sesudah ia menjelaskan segala sesuatu kepada mereka, ia menyuruh mereka ke Yope.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now on the next day as they were on their journey, and got close to the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray at about noon.

block.text: Keesokan harinya ketika ketiga orang itu berada dalam perjalanan dan sudah dekat kota Yope, kira-kira pukul dua belas tengah hari, naiklah Petrus ke atas rumah untuk berdoa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He became hungry and desired to eat, but while they were preparing, he fell into a trance.

block.text: Ia merasa lapar dan ingin makan, tetapi sementara makanan disediakan, tiba-tiba rohnya diliputi kuasa ilahi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He saw heaven opened and a certain container descending to him, like a great sheet let down by four corners on the earth.

block.text: Tampak olehnya langit terbuka dan turunlah suatu benda berbentuk kain lebar yang bergantung pada keempat sudutnya, yang diturunkan ke tanah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the sheet were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, reptiles, and birds of the sky.
A voice came to him,

block.text: Di dalamnya terdapat pelbagai jenis binatang berkaki empat, binatang menjalar dan burung.
Kedengaranlah olehnya suatu suara yang berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rise, Peter, kill and eat!”

block.text: <<Bangunlah, hai Petrus, sembelihlah dan makanlah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter said,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean.”

block.text: <<Tidak, Tuhan, tidak, sebab aku belum pernah makan sesuatu yang haram dan yang tidak tahir.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: A voice came to him again the second time,

block.text: Kedengaran pula untuk kedua kalinya suara yang berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What God has cleansed, you must not call unclean.”

block.text: <<Apa yang dinyatakan halal oleh Allah, tidak boleh engkau nyatakan haram.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was done three times, and immediately the vessel was received up into heaven.

block.text: Hal ini terjadi sampai tiga kali dan segera sesudah itu terangkatlah benda itu ke langit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Peter was very perplexed and he wondered:

block.text: Petrus bertanya-tanya di dalam hatinya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does this vision mean?”

block.text: apa kiranya arti penglihatan yang telah dilihatnya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Meanwhile, the men who were sent by Cornelius, were looking for Simon's house, and were now standing at the gate.
They called out and asked:

block.text: Sementara itu telah sampai di muka pintu orang-orang yang disuruh oleh Kornelius dan yang berusaha mengetahui di mana rumah Petrus.
Mereka memanggil seorang dan bertanya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is Simon, who is surnamed Peter lodging here?”

block.text: apakah Simon yang disebut Petrus ada menumpang di rumah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him,

block.text: Dan ketika Petrus sedang berpikir tentang penglihatan itu, berkatalah Roh:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, three men seek you.
Arise, go down and go with them, doubting nothing; for I have sent them.”

block.text: <<Ada tiga orang mencari engkau.
Bangunlah, turunlah ke bawah dan berangkatlah bersama-sama dengan mereka, jangan bimbang, sebab Aku yang menyuruh mereka ke mari.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter went down to the men, and said,

block.text: Lalu turunlah Petrus ke bawah dan berkata kepada orang-orang itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I am he whom you seek. Why have you come?”

block.text: <<Akulah yang kamu cari; apakah maksud kedatangan kamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We were sent by Cornelius, a centurion, a righteous man and one who fears God, and well spoken of by all the nation of the Jews. He was directed by a holy angel to invite you to his house, and to listen to what you say.”

block.text: "Kami dikirim oleh Kornelius, seorang perwira, orang benar dan orang yang takut akan Allah, dan juga dibicarakan oleh seluruh bangsa Yahudi. Ia diarahkan oleh seorang malaikat yang suci untuk mengundang Anda ke rumahnya, dan untuk mendengarkan apa yang Anda katakan. "».

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he called them in and lodged them.

block.text: Ia mempersilakan mereka untuk bermalam di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day Peter arose and went out with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.

block.text: Keesokan harinya ia bangun dan berangkat bersama-sama dengan mereka, dan beberapa saudara dari Yope menyertai dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day they entered into Caesarea. Cornelius was waiting for them, having called together his relatives and his near friends.

block.text: Dan pada hari berikutnya sampailah mereka di Kaisarea. Kornelius sedang menantikan mereka dan ia telah memanggil sanak saudaranya dan sahabat-sahabatnya berkumpul.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it happened that Peter entered, Cornelius met him, fell down at his feet, and worshiped him.

block.text: Ketika Petrus masuk, datanglah Kornelius menyambutnya, dan sambil tersungkur di depan kakinya, ia menyembah Petrus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter raised him up, saying,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus menegakkan dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stand up! I myself am also a man.”

block.text: <<Bangunlah, aku hanya manusia saja.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he talked with him, he went in and found many gathered together.
He said to them,

block.text: Dan sambil bercakap-cakap dengan dia, ia masuk dan mendapati banyak orang sedang berkumpul.
Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You yourselves know how it is an unlawful thing for a man who is a Jew to join himself or come to one of another nation. But God has shown me that I shouldn't call any man unholy or unclean.

block.text: <<Kamu tahu, betapa kerasnya larangan bagi seorang Yahudi untuk bergaul dengan orang-orang yang bukan Yahudi atau masuk ke rumah mereka. Tetapi Allah telah menunjukkan kepadaku, bahwa aku tidak boleh menyebut orang najis atau tidak tahir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore also I came without complaint when I was sent for. I ask therefore, why did you send for me?”

block.text: Itulah sebabnya aku tidak berkeberatan ketika aku dipanggil, lalu datang ke mari. Sekarang aku ingin tahu, apa sebabnya kamu memanggil aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Cornelius said,

block.text: Jawab Kornelius:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Four days ago, I was fasting until this hour, and at the ninth hour, I prayed in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,

block.text: <<Empat hari yang lalu kira-kira pada waktu yang sama seperti sekarang, yaitu jam tiga petang, aku sedang berdoa di rumah. Tiba-tiba ada seorang berdiri di depanku, pakaiannya berkilau-kilauan

ReferenceBlocks.text: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer is heard, and your gifts to the needy are remembered in the sight of God.

block.text: dan ia berkata: <Kornelius, doamu telah didengarkan Allah dan sedekahmu telah diingatkan di hadapan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Send therefore to Joppa, and summon Simon, who is surnamed Peter. He lodges in the house of Simon a tanner, by the seaside. When he comes, he will speak to you.’

block.text: Suruhlah orang ke Yope untuk menjemput Simon yang disebut Petrus; ia sedang menumpang di rumah Simon, seorang penyamak kulit, yang tinggal di tepi laut.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I sent to you at once, and it was good of you to come. Now therefore we are all here present in the sight of God to hear all things that have been commanded you by God.”

block.text: Karena itu segera kusuruh orang kepadamu, dan dengan senang hati engkau telah datang. Sekarang kami semua sudah hadir di sini di hadapan Allah untuk mendengarkan apa yang ditugaskan Allah kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter opened his mouth and said,

block.text: Lalu mulailah Petrus berbicara, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly I perceive that God doesn't show favoritism;

block.text: <<Sesungguhnya aku telah mengerti, bahwa Allah tidak membedakan orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but in every nation he who fears him and works righteousness is acceptable to him.

block.text: Setiap orang dari bangsa manapun yang takut akan Dia dan yang mengamalkan kebenaran berkenan kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The word which he sent to the children of Israel, preaching good news of peace by Jesus Christ--he is Lord of all—

block.text: Itulah firman yang Ia suruh sampaikan kepada orang-orang Israel, yaitu firman yang memberitakan damai sejahtera oleh Yesus Kristus, yang adalah Tuhan dari semua orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: you know what happened, which was proclaimed throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;

block.text: Kamu tahu tentang segala sesuatu yang terjadi di seluruh tanah Yudea, mulai dari Galilea, sesudah baptisan yang diberitakan oleh Yohanes,

ReferenceBlocks.text: even Jesus of Nazareth, how God anointed him with the Holy Spirit and with power. He went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with him.

block.text: yaitu tentang Yesus dari Nazaret: bagaimana Allah mengurapi Dia dengan Roh Kudus dan kuat kuasa, Dia, yang berjalan berkeliling sambil berbuat baik dan menyembuhkan semua orang yang dikuasai Iblis, sebab Allah menyertai Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: We are witnesses of everything he did both in the country of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they also killed, hanging him on a tree.

block.text: <<Dan kami adalah saksi dari segala sesuatu yang diperbuat-Nya di tanah Yudea maupun di Yerusalem; dan mereka telah membunuh Dia dan menggantung Dia pada kayu salib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God raised him up the third day, and caused him to be seen.

block.text: Yesus itu telah dibangkitkan Allah pada hari yang ketiga, dan Allah berkenan, bahwa Ia menampakkan diri,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was not seen by all the people, but by witnesses whom God had already chosen -- by us, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.

block.text: bukan kepada seluruh bangsa, tetapi kepada saksi-saksi, yang sebelumnya telah ditunjuk oleh Allah, yaitu kepada kami yang telah makan dan minum bersama-sama dengan Dia, setelah Ia bangkit dari antara orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that this is he who is appointed by God as the Judge of the living and the dead.

block.text: Dan Ia telah menugaskan kami memberitakan kepada seluruh bangsa dan bersaksi, bahwa Dialah yang ditentukan Allah menjadi Hakim atas orang-orang hidup dan orang-orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the prophets testify about him, that through his name everyone who believes in him will receive remission of sins.”

block.text: Tentang Dialah semua nabi bersaksi, bahwa barangsiapa percaya kepada-Nya, ia akan mendapat pengampunan dosa oleh karena nama-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell on all those who heard the word.

block.text: Ketika Petrus sedang berkata demikian, turunlah Roh Kudus ke atas semua orang yang mendengarkan pemberitaan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They of the circumcision who believed were amazed, as many as came with Peter, because the gift of the Holy Spirit was also poured out on the Gentiles.

block.text: Dan semua orang percaya dari golongan bersunat yang menyertai Petrus, tercengang-cengang, karena melihat, bahwa karunia Roh Kudus dicurahkan ke atas bangsa-bangsa lain juga,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they heard them speaking in other languages and magnifying God. Then Peter answered,

block.text: sebab mereka mendengar orang-orang itu berkata-kata dalam bahasa roh dan memuliakan Allah. Lalu kata Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can any man forbid the water, that these who have received the Holy Spirit as well as we should not be baptized?”

block.text: <<Bolehkah orang mencegah untuk membaptis orang-orang ini dengan air, sedangkan mereka telah menerima Roh Kudus sama seperti kita?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay some days.

block.text: Lalu ia menyuruh mereka dibaptis dalam nama Yesus Kristus. Kemudian mereka meminta Petrus, supaya ia tinggal beberapa hari lagi bersama-sama dengan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 11
Now the apostles and the brothers who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

block.text: Rasul-rasul dan saudara-saudara di Yudea mendengar, bahwa bangsa-bangsa lain juga menerima firman Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter had come up to Jerusalem, those who were of the circumcision contended with him,
saying,

block.text: Ketika Petrus tiba di Yerusalem, orang-orang dari golongan yang bersunat berselisih pendapat dengan dia.
Kata mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You went to uncircumcised men and ate with them!”

block.text: <<Engkau telah masuk ke rumah orang-orang yang tidak bersunat dan makan bersama-sama dengan mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter began, and explained to them in order, saying,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus menjelaskan segala sesuatu berturut-turut, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision: I saw something like a large sheet let down from heaven by four corners. It came down to where I was.

block.text: <<Aku sedang berdoa di kota Yope, tiba-tiba rohku diliputi kuasa ilahi dan aku melihat suatu penglihatan: suatu benda berbentuk kain lebar yang bergantung pada keempat sudutnya diturunkan dari langit sampai di depanku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I had looked intently at it, I considered, and saw the four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, creeping things, and birds of the sky.

block.text: Aku menatapnya dan di dalamnya aku lihat segala jenis binatang berkaki empat dan binatang liar dan binatang menjalar dan burung-burung.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Rise, Peter, kill and eat!’

block.text: Lalu aku mendengar suara berkata kepadaku: <Bangunlah, hai Petrus, sembelihlah dan makanlah!>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I said, ‘Not so, Lord, for nothing unholy or unclean has ever entered into my mouth.’

block.text: Tetapi aku berkata: <Tidak, Tuhan, tidak, sebab belum pernah sesuatu yang haram dan yang tidak tahir masuk ke dalam mulutku.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But a voice answered me the second time out of heaven, ‘What God has cleansed, don't you call unclean.’

block.text: Akan tetapi untuk kedua kalinya suara dari sorga berkata kepadaku: <Apa yang dinyatakan halal oleh Allah, tidak boleh engkau nyatakan haram!>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was done three times, and all were drawn up again into heaven.

block.text: Hal itu terjadi sampai tiga kali, lalu semuanya ditarik kembali ke langit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, immediately three men stood before the house where I was, having been sent from Caesarea to me.

block.text: <<Dan seketika itu juga tiga orang berdiri di depan rumah, di mana kami menumpang; mereka diutus kepadaku dari Kaisarea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Spirit told me to go with them, without discriminating. These six brothers also accompanied me, and we entered into the man's house.

block.text: Lalu kata Roh kepadaku: <Pergi bersama mereka dengan tidak bimbang!> Dan keenam saudara ini menyertai aku. Kami masuk ke dalam rumah orang itu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He told us how he had seen the angel standing in his house, and saying to him, ‘Send to Joppa, and get Simon, whose surname is Peter.

block.text: dan ia menceriterakan kepada kami, bagaimana ia melihat seorang malaikat berdiri di dalam rumahnya dan berkata kepadanya: <Suruhlah orang ke Yope untuk menjemput Simon yang disebut Petrus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will speak to you words by which you will be saved, you and all your house.’

block.text: Ia akan menyampaikan suatu berita kepada kamu, yang akan mendatangkan keselamatan bagimu dan bagi seluruh isi rumahmu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, even as on us at the beginning.

block.text: <<Dan ketika aku mulai berbicara, turunlah Roh Kudus ke atas mereka, sama seperti dahulu ke atas kita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, ‘John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit.’

block.text: Maka teringatlah aku akan perkataan Tuhan: <Yohanes membaptis dengan air, tetapi kamu akan dibaptis dengan Roh Kudus.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: If then God gave to them the same gift as us, when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I, that I could withstand God?”

block.text: Jadi jika Allah memberikan karunia-Nya kepada mereka sama seperti kepada kita pada waktu kita mulai percaya kepada Yesus Kristus, bagaimanakah mungkin aku mencegah Dia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying,

block.text: Ketika mereka mendengar hal itu, mereka menjadi tenang, lalu memuliakan Allah, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then God has also granted to the Gentiles repentance to life!”

block.text: <<Jadi kepada bangsa-bangsa lain juga Allah mengaruniakan pertobatan yang memimpin kepada hidup.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They therefore who were scattered abroad by the oppression that arose about Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except to Jews only.

block.text: Sementara itu banyak saudara-saudara telah tersebar karena penganiayaan yang timbul sesudah Stefanus dihukum mati. Mereka tersebar sampai ke Fenisia, Siprus dan Antiokhia; namun mereka memberitakan Injil kepada orang Yahudi saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.

block.text: Akan tetapi di antara mereka ada beberapa orang Siprus dan orang Kirene yang tiba di Antiokhia dan berkata-kata juga kepada orang-orang Yunani dan memberitakan Injil, bahwa Yesus adalah Tuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.

block.text: Dan tangan Tuhan menyertai mereka dan sejumlah besar orang menjadi percaya dan berbalik kepada Tuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The report concerning them came to the ears of the assembly which was in Jerusalem. They sent out Barnabas to go as far as Antioch.

block.text: Maka sampailah kabar tentang mereka itu kepada jemaat di Yerusalem, lalu jemaat itu mengutus Barnabas ke Antiokhia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come and had seen the grace of God, he was glad. He exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they should remain near to the Lord.

block.text: Setelah Barnabas datang dan melihat kasih karunia Allah, bersukacitalah ia. Ia menasihati mereka, supaya mereka semua tetap setia kepada Tuhan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith, and many people were added to the Lord.

block.text: karena Barnabas adalah orang baik, penuh dengan Roh Kudus dan iman. Sejumlah orang dibawa kepada Tuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Barnabas went out to Tarsus to look for Saul.

block.text: Lalu pergilah Barnabas ke Tarsus untuk mencari Saulus; dan setelah bertemu dengan dia, ia membawanya ke Antiokhia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. It happened, that for a whole year they were gathered together with the assembly, and taught many people. The disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.

block.text: When he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. It happened, that for a whole year they were gathered together with the assembly, and taught many people. The disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in those days, prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

block.text: Pada waktu itu datanglah beberapa nabi dari Yerusalem ke Antiokhia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of them named Agabus stood up. Being prompted by the Holy Spirit, he said:

block.text: Seorang dari mereka yang bernama Agabus bangkit dan oleh kuasa Roh ia mengatakan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There will be a large famine all over the world.”

block.text: bahwa seluruh dunia akan ditimpa bahaya kelaparan yang besar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (This famine happened in the days of Claudius.)

block.text: Hal itu terjadi juga pada zaman Klaudius.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Since the disciples had plenty, they each decided to send help to the brothers who lived in Judea;

block.text: Lalu murid-murid memutuskan untuk mengumpulkan suatu sumbangan, sesuai dengan kemampuan mereka masing-masing dan mengirimkannya kepada saudara-saudara yang diam di Yudea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They did this, sending it to the elders by Barnabas and Saul.

block.text: Hal itu mereka lakukan juga dan mereka mengirimkannya kepada penatua-penatua dengan perantaraan Barnabas dan Saulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 12
Now about that time, King Herod stretched out his hands to oppress some of the assembly.

block.text: Kira-kira pada waktu itu raja Herodes mulai bertindak dengan keras terhadap beberapa orang dari jemaat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He killed James, the brother of John, with the sword.

block.text: Ia menyuruh membunuh Yakobus, saudara Yohanes, dengan pedang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to seize Peter also. This was during the days of unleavened bread.

block.text: Ketika ia melihat, bahwa hal itu menyenangkan hati orang Yahudi, ia melanjutkan perbuatannya itu dan menyuruh menahan Petrus. Waktu itu hari raya Roti Tidak Beragi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had arrested him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four squads of four soldiers each to guard him. He intended to bring him out to the people after the Passover.

block.text: Setelah Petrus ditangkap, Herodes menyuruh memenjarakannya di bawah penjagaan empat regu, masing-masing terdiri dari empat prajurit. Maksudnya ialah, supaya sehabis Paskah ia menghadapkannya ke depan orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter therefore was kept in the prison, but constant prayer was made by the assembly to God for him.

block.text: Demikianlah Petrus ditahan di dalam penjara. Tetapi jemaat dengan tekun mendoakannya kepada Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same night when Herod was about to bring him out, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, and was bound with two chains. Guards in front of the door kept the prison.

block.text: Pada malam sebelum Herodes hendak menghadapkannya kepada orang banyak, Petrus tidur di antara dua orang prajurit, terbelenggu dengan dua rantai. Selain itu prajurit-prajurit pengawal sedang berkawal di muka pintu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood by him, and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side, and woke him up, saying,

block.text: Tiba-tiba berdirilah seorang malaikat Tuhan dekat Petrus dan cahaya bersinar dalam ruang itu. Malaikat itu menepuk Petrus untuk membangunkannya, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stand up quickly!”

block.text: <<Bangunlah segera!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His chains fell off from his hands.

block.text: Maka gugurlah rantai itu dari tangan Petrus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The angel said to him,

block.text: Lalu kata malaikat itu kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get dressed and put on your sandals.”

block.text: <<Ikatlah pinggangmu

ReferenceBlocks.text: He did so. He said to him,

block.text: Jawab, dan kenakanlah sepatumu!>> Iapun berbuat demikian. Lalu malaikat itu berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Put on your cloak, and follow me.”

block.text: <<Kenakanlah jubahmu dan ikutlah aku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he went out and followed him. He didn't know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he saw a vision.

block.text: Lalu ia mengikuti malaikat itu ke luar dan ia tidak tahu, bahwa apa yang dilakukan malaikat itu sungguh-sungguh terjadi, sangkanya ia melihat suatu penglihatan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they were past the first and the second guard, they came to the iron gate that leads into the city, which opened to them by itself. They went out, and went down one street, and immediately the angel departed from him.

block.text: Setelah mereka melalui tempat kawal pertama dan tempat kawal kedua, sampailah mereka ke pintu gerbang besi yang menuju ke kota. Pintu itu terbuka dengan sendirinya bagi mereka. Sesudah tiba di luar, mereka berjalan sampai ke ujung jalan, dan tiba-tiba malaikat itu meninggalkan dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter had come to himself, he said,

block.text: Dan setelah sadar akan dirinya, Petrus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now I truly know that the Lord has sent out his angel and delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from everything the Jewish people were expecting.”

block.text: <<Sekarang tahulah aku benar-benar bahwa Tuhan telah menyuruh malaikat-Nya dan menyelamatkan aku dari tangan Herodes dan dari segala sesuatu yang diharapkan orang Yahudi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thinking about that, he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John whose surname was Mark, where many were gathered together and were praying.

block.text: Dan setelah berpikir sebentar, pergilah ia ke rumah Maria, ibu Yohanes yang disebut juga Markus. Di situ banyak orang berkumpul dan berdoa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a maid named Rhoda came to answer.

block.text: Dan ketika ia mengetuk pintu gerbang, datanglah seorang hamba perempuan bernama Rode untuk mengetahui siapa yang mengetuk itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she recognized Peter's voice, she didn't open the gate for joy, but ran in, and reported that Peter was standing in front of the gate.
They said to her,

block.text: Ia terus mengenal suara Petrus, tetapi karena girangnya ia tidak membuka pintu gerbang itu dan segera masuk ke dalam untuk memberitahukan, bahwa Petrus ada di depan pintu gerbang.
Kata mereka kepada perempuan itu:

block.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house
ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are crazy!”

block.text: <<Engkau mengigau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But she insisted:

block.text: Akan tetapi ia tetap mengatakan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is true… he is at the door!”

block.text: bahwa benar-benar demikian.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Kata mereka:

block.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house
ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is his angel.”

block.text: <<Itu malaikatnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter continued knocking. When they had opened, they saw him, and were amazed.

block.text: Tetapi Petrus terus-menerus mengetuk dan ketika mereka membuka pintu dan melihat dia, mereka tercengang-cengang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, beckoning to them with his hand to be silent, declared to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. He said,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus memberi isyarat dengan tangannya, supaya mereka diam, lalu ia menceriterakan bagaimana Tuhan menuntunnya ke luar dari penjara. Katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell these things to James, and to the brothers.”

block.text: <<Beritahukanlah hal ini kepada Yakobus dan saudara-saudara kita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he departed, and went to another place.

block.text: Lalu ia keluar dan pergi ke tempat lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers about what had become of Peter.

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya gemparlah prajurit-prajurit itu. Mereka bertanya-tanya apakah yang telah terjadi dengan Petrus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Herod had sought for him, and didn't find him, he examined the guards, and commanded that they should be put to death. He went down from Judea to Caesarea, and stayed there.

block.text: Herodes menyuruh mencari Petrus, tetapi ia tidak ditemukan. Lalu Herodes menyuruh memeriksa pengawal-pengawal itu dan membunuh mereka. Kemudian ia berangkat dari Yudea ke Kaisarea dan tinggal di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon. They came with one accord to him, and, having befriended Blastus, the king's personal aide, they asked for peace because their country depended on the king's country for food.

block.text: Herodes sangat marah terhadap orang Tirus dan Sidon. Atas persetujuan bersama mereka pergi menghadap dia. Mereka berhasil membujuk Blastus, pegawai istana raja, ke pihak mereka, lalu mereka memohonkan perdamaian, karena negeri mereka beroleh bahan makanan dari wilayah raja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On an appointed day, Herod dressed himself in royal clothing, sat on the throne, and gave a speech to them.
The people shouted,

block.text: Dan pada suatu hari yang ditentukan, Herodes mengenakan pakaian kerajaan, lalu duduk di atas takhta dan berpidato kepada mereka.
Dan rakyatnya bersorak membalasnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The voice of a god, and not of a man!”

block.text: <<Ini suara allah dan bukan suara manusia!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him, because he didn't give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and died.

block.text: Dan seketika itu juga ia ditampar malaikat Tuhan karena ia tidak memberi hormat kepada Allah; ia mati dimakan cacing-cacing.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the word of God grew and multiplied.

block.text: Maka firman Tuhan makin tersebar dan makin banyak didengar orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their service, also taking with them John whose surname was Mark.

block.text: Barnabas dan Saulus kembali dari Yerusalem, setelah mereka menyelesaikan tugas pelayanan mereka. Mereka membawa Yohanes, yang disebut juga Markus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 13
Now in the assembly that was at Antioch there were some prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen the foster brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

block.text: Pada waktu itu dalam jemaat di Antiokhia ada beberapa nabi dan pengajar, yaitu: Barnabas dan Simeon yang disebut Niger, dan Lukius orang Kirene, dan Menahem yang diasuh bersama dengan raja wilayah Herodes, dan Saulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they served the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said,

block.text: Pada suatu hari ketika mereka beribadah kepada Tuhan dan berpuasa, berkatalah Roh Kudus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Separate Barnabas and Saul for me, for the work to which I have called them.”

block.text: <<Khususkanlah Barnabas dan Saulus bagi-Ku untuk tugas yang telah Kutentukan bagi mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then, when they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.

block.text: Maka berpuasa dan berdoalah mereka, dan setelah meletakkan tangan ke atas kedua orang itu, mereka membiarkan keduanya pergi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia. From there they sailed to Cyprus.

block.text: Oleh karena disuruh Roh Kudus, Barnabas dan Saulus berangkat ke Seleukia, dan dari situ mereka berlayar ke Siprus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they were at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. They had also John as their attendant.

block.text: Setiba di Salamis mereka memberitakan firman Allah di dalam rumah-rumah ibadat orang Yahudi. Dan Yohanes menyertai mereka sebagai pembantu mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had gone through the island to Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar Jesus.

block.text: Mereka mengelilingi seluruh pulau itu sampai ke Pafos. Di situ mereka bertemu dengan seorang Yahudi bernama Baryesus. Ia seorang tukang sihir dan nabi palsu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a man of understanding. This man summoned Barnabas and Saul, and sought to hear the word of God.

block.text: Ia adalah kawan gubernur pulau itu, Sergius Paulus, yang adalah orang cerdas. Gubernur itu memanggil Barnabas dan Saulus, karena ia ingin mendengar firman Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn aside the proconsul from the faith.

block.text: Tetapi Elimas—demikianlah namanya dalam bahasa Yunani—,tukang sihir itu, menghalang-halangi mereka dan berusaha membelokkan gubernur itu dari imannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Saul, who is also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, fastened his eyes on him,
and said,

block.text: Tetapi Saulus, juga disebut Paulus, yang penuh dengan Roh Kudus, menatap dia,
dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Full of all deceit and all cunning, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness!

block.text: <<Hai anak Iblis, engkau penuh dengan rupa-rupa tipu muslihat dan kejahatan, engkau musuh segala kebenaran,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Will you not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?

block.text: tidakkah engkau akan berhenti membelokkan Jalan Tuhan yang lurus itu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now, behold, the hand of the Lord is on you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun for a season!”

block.text: Sekarang, lihatlah, tangan Tuhan datang menimpa engkau, dan engkau menjadi buta, beberapa hari lamanya engkau tidak dapat melihat matahari.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately a mist and darkness fell on him. He went around seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

block.text: Dan seketika itu juga orang itu merasa diliputi kabut dan gelap, dan sambil meraba-raba ia harus mencari orang untuk menuntun dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the proconsul, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.

block.text: Melihat apa yang telah terjadi itu, percayalah gubernur itu; ia takjub oleh ajaran Tuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Paul and his company set sail from Paphos, and came to Perga in Pamphylia. John departed from them and returned to Jerusalem.

block.text: Lalu Paulus dan kawan-kawannya meninggalkan Pafos dan berlayar ke Perga di Pamfilia; tetapi Yohanes meninggalkan mereka lalu kembali ke Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they, passing on from Perga, came to Antioch of Pisidia. They went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and sat down.

block.text: Dari Perga mereka melanjutkan perjalanan mereka, lalu tiba di Antiokhia di Pisidia. Pada hari Sabat mereka pergi ke rumah ibadat, lalu duduk di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them, saying,

block.text: Setelah selesai pembacaan dari hukum Taurat dan kitab nabi-nabi, pejabat-pejabat rumah ibadat menyuruh bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, speak.”

block.text: <<Saudara-saudara, jikalau saudara-saudara ada pesan untuk membangun dan menghibur umat ini, silakanlah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul stood up, and beckoning with his hand said,

block.text: Maka bangkitlah Paulus. Ia memberi isyarat dengan tangannya, lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen.

block.text: <<Hai orang-orang Israel dan kamu yang takut akan Allah, dengarkanlah!

ReferenceBlocks.text: The God of this people chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they stayed as aliens in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm, he led them out of it.

block.text: Allah umat Israel ini telah memilih nenek moyang kita dan membuat umat itu menjadi besar, ketika mereka tinggal di Mesir sebagai orang asing. Dengan tangan-Nya yang luhur Ia telah memimpin mereka keluar dari negeri itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a period of about forty years he put up with them in the wilderness.

block.text: Empat puluh tahun lamanya Ia sabar terhadap tingkah laku mereka di padang gurun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land for an inheritance, for about four hundred fifty years.

block.text: Dan setelah membinasakan tujuh bangsa di tanah Kanaan, Ia membagi-bagikan tanah itu kepada mereka untuk menjadi warisan mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these things he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

block.text: selama kira-kira empat ratus lima puluh tahun. Sesudah itu Ia memberikan mereka hakim-hakim sampai pada zaman nabi Samuel.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward they asked for a king, and God gave to them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.

block.text: <<Kemudian mereka meminta seorang raja dan Allah memberikan kepada mereka Saul bin Kish dari suku Benyamin, empat puluh tahun lamanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had removed him, he raised up David to be their king, to whom he also testified, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after my heart, who will do all my will.’

block.text: Setelah Saul disingkirkan, Allah mengangkat Daud menjadi raja mereka. Tentang Daud Allah telah menyatakan: <Aku telah mendapat Daud bin Isai, seorang yang berkenan di hati-Ku dan yang melakukan segala kehendak-Ku.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: From this man's seed, God has brought salvation to Israel according to his promise.

block.text: <<Dan dari keturunannyalah, sesuai dengan yang telah dijanjikan-Nya, Allah telah membangkitkan Juruselamat bagi orang Israel, yaitu Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Before Jesus came, John had first preached the baptism of repentance to Israel.

block.text: Menjelang kedatangan-Nya Yohanes telah menyerukan kepada seluruh bangsa Israel supaya mereka bertobat dan memberi diri dibaptis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As John was fulfilling his course, he said, ‘What do you suppose that I am? I am not he. But behold, one comes after me the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to untie.’

block.text: Dan ketika Yohanes hampir selesai menunaikan tugasnya, ia berkata: <Aku bukanlah Dia yang kamu sangka, tetapi Ia akan datang kemudian dari padaku. Membuka kasut dari kaki-Nyapun aku tidak layak.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Brothers, children of the stock of Abraham, and those among you who fear God, the word of this salvation is sent out to you.

block.text: <<Hai saudara-saudaraku, baik yang termasuk keturunan Abraham, maupun yang takut akan Allah, kabar keselamatan itu sudah disampaikan kepada kita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the inhabitants of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize Jesus. By condemning him they fulfilled the words of the prophets which are read every sabbath day.”

block.text: Sebab penduduk Yerusalem dan pemimpin-pemimpinnya tidak mengakui Yesus. Dengan menjatuhkan hukuman mati atas Dia, mereka menggenapi perkataan nabi-nabi yang dibacakan setiap hari Sabat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Though they found no cause for death, they still asked Pilate to have him killed.

block.text: <<Dan meskipun mereka tidak menemukan sesuatu yang dapat menjadi alasan untuk hukuman mati itu, namun mereka telah meminta kepada Pilatus supaya Ia dibunuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had fulfilled all things that were written about him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a tomb.

block.text: Dan setelah mereka menggenapi segala sesuatu yang ada tertulis tentang Dia, mereka menurunkan Dia dari kayu salib, lalu membaringkan-Nya di dalam kubur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But God raised him from the dead.

block.text: Tetapi Allah membangkitkan Dia dari antara orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was seen for many days by those who came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses to the people.

block.text: Dan selama beberapa waktu Ia menampakkan diri kepada mereka yang mengikuti Dia dari Galilea ke Yerusalem. Mereka itulah yang sekarang menjadi saksi-Nya bagi umat ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: We bring you good news of the promise made to the fathers,

block.text: <<Dan kami sekarang memberitakan kabar kesukaan kepada kamu, yaitu bahwa janji yang diberikan kepada nenek moyang kita,

ReferenceBlocks.text: that God has fulfilled the same to us, their children, in that he raised up Jesus. As it is also written in the second psalm, ‘You are my Son. Today I have become your father.’”

block.text: telah digenapi Allah kepada kita, keturunan mereka, dengan membangkitkan Yesus, seperti yang ada tertulis dalam mazmur kedua: <Anak-Ku Engkau! Aku telah memperanakkan Engkau pada hari ini.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he has spoken thus: ‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.’

block.text: Allah telah membangkitkan Dia dari antara orang mati dan Ia tidak akan diserahkan kembali kepada kebinasaan. Hal itu dinyatakan oleh Tuhan dalam firman ini: <Aku akan menggenapi kepadamu janji-janji yang kudus yang dapat dipercayai, yang telah Kuberikan kepada Daud.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore he says also in another psalm, ‘You will not allow your Holy One to see decay.’

block.text: Sebab itu Ia mengatakan dalam mazmur yang lain: <Engkau tidak akan membiarkan Orang Kudus-Mu melihat kebinasaan.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For David, after he had in his own generation served the counsel of God, fell asleep, and was laid with his fathers, and saw decay.

block.text: <<Sebab Daud melakukan kehendak Allah pada zamannya, lalu ia mangkat dan dibaringkan di samping nenek moyangnya, dan ia memang diserahkan kepada kebinasaan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he whom God raised up saw no decay.

block.text: Tetapi Yesus, yang dibangkitkan Allah, tidak demikian.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be it known unto you therefore, brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins.

block.text: Jadi ketahuilah, hai saudara-saudara, oleh karena Dialah maka diberitakan kepada kamu pengampunan dosa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Through him everyone who believes is justified from all things, from which they could not be justified by the law of Moses.

block.text: Dan di dalam Dialah setiap orang yang percaya memperoleh pembebasan dari segala dosa, yang tidak dapat kamu peroleh dari hukum Musa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Beware therefore, lest that come on you which is spoken in the prophets:

block.text: Karena itu, waspadalah, supaya jangan berlaku atas kamu apa yang telah dikatakan dalam kitab nabi-nabi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Behold, you scoffers, and wonder, and perish; for I work a work in your days, a work which you will in no way believe, if one declares it to you.’”

block.text: <Ingatlah, hai kamu penghina-penghina, tercenganglah dan lenyaplah, sebab Aku melakukan suatu pekerjaan dalam zamanmu, suatu pekerjaan, yang tidak akan kamu percayai, jika diceriterakan kepadamu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when the Jews went out of the synagogue, the Gentiles begged him, saying:

block.text: Ketika Paulus dan Barnabas keluar,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Preach these words to us on the next Sabbath.”

block.text: mereka diminta untuk berbicara tentang pokok itu pula pada hari Sabat berikutnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the synagogue broke up, many of the Jews and of the devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas; Paul and Barnabas spoke to them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.

block.text: Setelah selesai ibadah, banyak orang Yahudi dan penganut-penganut agama Yahudi yang takut akan Allah, mengikuti Paulus dan Barnabas; kedua rasul itu mengajar mereka dan menasihati supaya mereka tetap hidup di dalam kasih karunia Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The next Sabbath almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of God.

block.text: Pada hari Sabat berikutnya datanglah hampir seluruh kota itu berkumpul untuk mendengar firman Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with jealousy, and contradicted the things which were spoken by Paul, and blasphemed.

block.text: Akan tetapi, ketika orang Yahudi melihat orang banyak itu, penuhlah mereka dengan iri hati dan sambil menghujat, mereka membantah apa yang dikatakan oleh Paulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly, and said,

block.text: Tetapi dengan berani Paulus dan Barnabas berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It was necessary that God's word should be spoken to you first. Since indeed you thrust it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles.

block.text: <<Memang kepada kamulah firman Allah harus diberitakan lebih dahulu, tetapi kamu menolaknya dan menganggap dirimu tidak layak untuk beroleh hidup yang kekal. Karena itu kami berpaling kepada bangsa-bangsa lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For so has the Lord commanded us, saying, ‘I have set you as a light for the Gentiles, that you should bring salvation to the uttermost parts of the earth.’”

block.text: Sebab inilah yang diperintahkan kepada kami: <Aku telah menentukan engkau menjadi terang bagi bangsa-bangsa yang tidak mengenal Allah, supaya engkau membawa keselamatan sampai ke ujung bumi.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of God. As many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

block.text: Mendengar itu bergembiralah semua orang yang tidak mengenal Allah dan mereka memuliakan firman Tuhan; dan semua orang yang ditentukan Allah untuk hidup yang kekal, menjadi percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord's word was spread abroad throughout all the region.

block.text: Lalu firman Tuhan disiarkan di seluruh daerah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and prominent women and the chief men of the city, and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and threw them out of their borders.

block.text: Orang-orang Yahudi menghasut perempuan-perempuan terkemuka yang takut akan Allah, dan pembesar-pembesar di kota itu, dan mereka menimbulkan penganiayaan atas Paulus dan Barnabas dan mengusir mereka dari daerah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came to Iconium.

block.text: Akan tetapi Paulus dan Barnabas mengebaskan debu kaki mereka sebagai peringatan bagi orang-orang itu, lalu pergi ke Ikonium.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples were filled with joy with the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Dan murid-murid di Antiokhia penuh dengan sukacita dan dengan Roh Kudus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 14
It happened in Iconium that they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spoke that a great multitude both of Jews and of Greeks believed.

block.text: Di Ikoniumpun kedua rasul itu masuk ke rumah ibadat orang Yahudi, lalu mengajar sedemikian rupa, sehingga sejumlah besar orang Yahudi dan orang Yunani menjadi percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the disbelieving Jews stirred up and embittered the souls of the Gentiles against the brothers.

block.text: Tetapi orang-orang Yahudi, yang menolak pemberitaan mereka, memanaskan hati orang-orang yang tidak mengenal Allah dan membuat mereka gusar terhadap saudara-saudara itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore they stayed there a long time, speaking boldly in the Lord. The Lord testified to the word of his grace by granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

block.text: Paulus dan Barnabas tinggal beberapa waktu lamanya di situ. Mereka mengajar dengan berani, karena mereka percaya kepada Tuhan. Dan Tuhan menguatkan berita tentang kasih karunia-Nya dengan mengaruniakan kepada mereka kuasa untuk mengadakan tanda-tanda dan mujizat-mujizat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the multitude of the city was divided. Part sided with the Jews, and part with the apostles.
