block.text: Dalam segala sesuatu telah kuberikan contoh kepada kamu, bahwa dengan bekerja demikian kita harus membantu orang-orang yang lemah. Dan harus mengingat perkataan Tuhan Yesus, sebab Ia sendiri telah mengatakan: Adalah lebih berbahagia memberi dari pada menerima.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had spoken these things, he knelt down and prayed with them all.

block.text: Sesudah mengucapkan kata-kata itu Paulus berlutut dan berdoa bersama-sama dengan mereka semua.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all wept a lot, and fell on Paul's neck and kissed him.

block.text: Maka menangislah mereka semua tersedu-sedu dan sambil memeluk Paulus, mereka berulang-ulang mencium dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were sad most of all because of the word which he had spoken, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him to the ship.

block.text: Mereka sangat berdukacita, terlebih-lebih karena ia katakan, bahwa mereka tidak akan melihat mukanya lagi. Lalu mereka mengantar dia ke kapal.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 21
When it happened that we had parted from them and had set sail, we came with a straight course to Cos. The next day to we sailed to Rhodes, and from there to Patara.

block.text: Sesudah perpisahan yang berat itu bertolaklah kami dan langsung berlayar menuju Kos. Keesokan harinya sampailah kami di Rodos dan dari situ kami ke Patara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, we went aboard, and set sail.

block.text: Di Patara kami mendapat kapal, yang hendak menyeberang ke Fenisia. Kami naik kapal itu, lalu bertolak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had come in sight of Cyprus, leaving it on the left hand, we sailed to Syria. We landed at Tyre, for there the ship was to unload her cargo.

block.text: Kemudian tampak Siprus di sebelah kiri, tetapi kami melewatinya dan menuju ke Siria. Akhirnya tibalah kami di Tirus, sebab muatan kapal harus dibongkar di kota itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having found disciples, we stayed there seven days. These said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Di situ kami mengunjungi murid-murid dan tinggal di situ tujuh hari lamanya. Oleh bisikan Roh murid-murid itu menasihati Paulus, supaya ia jangan pergi ke Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it happened that we had accomplished the days, we departed and went on our journey. They all, with wives and children, brought us on our way until we were out of the city. Kneeling down on the beach, we prayed.

block.text: Tetapi setelah lewat waktunya, kami berangkat meneruskan perjalanan kami. Murid-murid semua dengan isteri dan anak-anak mereka mengantar kami sampai ke luar kota; dan di tepi pantai kami berlutut dan berdoa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After saying goodbye to each other, we went on board the ship, and they returned home again.

block.text: Sesudah minta diri kami naik ke kapal, dan mereka pulang ke rumah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had finished the voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais. We greeted the brothers, and stayed with them one day.

block.text: Dari Tirus kami tiba di Ptolemais dan di situ berakhirlah pelayaran kami. Kami memberi salam kepada saudara-saudara dan tinggal satu hari di antara mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day, we, who were Paul's companions, departed, and came to Caesarea. We entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and stayed with him.

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya kami berangkat dari situ dan tiba di Kaisarea. Kami masuk ke rumah Filipus, pemberita Injil itu, yaitu satu dari ketujuh orang yang dipilih di Yerusalem, dan kami tinggal di rumahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied.

block.text: Filipus mempunyai empat anak dara yang beroleh karunia untuk bernubuat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As we stayed there some days, a certain prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.

block.text: Setelah beberapa hari kami tinggal di situ, datanglah dari Yudea seorang nabi bernama Agabus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Coming to us, and taking Paul's belt, he bound his own feet and hands, and said,

block.text: Ia datang pada kami, lalu mengambil ikat pinggang Paulus. Sambil mengikat kaki dan tangannya sendiri ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Thus says the Holy Spirit: ‘So will the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man who owns this belt, and will deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’”

block.text: <<Demikianlah kata Roh Kudus: <Beginilah orang yang empunya ikat pinggang ini akan diikat oleh orang-orang Yahudi di Yerusalem dan diserahkan ke dalam tangan bangsa-bangsa lain.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we heard these things, both we and they of that place begged him not to go up to Jerusalem.
Then Paul answered,

block.text: Mendengar itu kami bersama-sama dengan murid-murid di tempat itu meminta, supaya Paulus jangan pergi ke Yerusalem.
Tetapi Paulus menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu menangis dan dengan jalan demikian mau menghancurkan hatiku? Sebab aku ini rela bukan saja untuk diikat, tetapi juga untuk mati di Yerusalem oleh karena nama Tuhan Yesus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying,

block.text: Karena ia tidak mau menerima nasihat kami, kami menyerah dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord's will be done.”

block.text: <<Jadilah kehendak Tuhan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these days we took up our baggage and went up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Sesudah beberapa hari lamanya tinggal di Kaisarea, berkemaslah kami, lalu berangkat ke Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us. They brought Mnason of Cyprus, an early disciple, with whom we would stay.

block.text: Bersama-sama dengan kami turut juga beberapa murid dari Kaisarea. Mereka membawa kami ke rumah seorang yang bernama Manason. Ia dari Siprus dan sudah lama menjadi murid. Kami akan menumpang di rumahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had come to Jerusalem, the brothers received us gladly.

block.text: Ketika kami tiba di Yerusalem, semua saudara menyambut kami dengan suka hati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The day following, Paul went in with us to James; and all the elders were present.

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya pergilah Paulus bersama-sama dengan kami mengunjungi Yakobus; semua penatua telah hadir di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had greeted them, he reported one by one the things which God had worked among the Gentiles through his ministry.

block.text: Paulus memberi salam kepada mereka, lalu menceriterakan dengan terperinci apa yang dilakukan Allah di antara bangsa-bangsa lain oleh pelayanannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, when they heard it, glorified God. They said to him,

block.text: Mendengar itu mereka memuliakan Allah. Lalu mereka berkata kepada Paulus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You see, brother, how many thousands there are among the Jews of those who have believed, and they are all zealous for the law.

block.text: <<Saudara, lihatlah, beribu-ribu orang Yahudi telah menjadi percaya dan mereka semua rajin memelihara hukum Taurat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They have been informed about you, that you teach all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses. They tell them not to circumcise their children neither to walk after the customs.

block.text: Tetapi mereka mendengar tentang engkau, bahwa engkau mengajar semua orang Yahudi yang tinggal di antara bangsa-bangsa lain untuk melepaskan hukum Musa, sebab engkau mengatakan, supaya mereka jangan menyunatkan anak-anaknya dan jangan hidup menurut adat istiadat kita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What then? The assembly must certainly meet, for they will hear that you have come.

block.text: Jadi bagaimana sekarang? Tentu mereka akan mendengar, bahwa engkau telah datang ke mari.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore do what we tell you. We have four men who have taken a vow.

block.text: <<Sebab itu, lakukanlah apa yang kami katakan ini: Di antara kami ada empat orang yang bernazar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take them, and purify yourself with them, and pay their expenses for them, that they may shave their heads. Then all will know that there is no truth in the things that they have been informed about you, but that you yourself also walk keeping the law.

block.text: Bawalah mereka bersama-sama dengan engkau, lakukanlah pentahiran dirimu bersama-sama dengan mereka dan tanggunglah biaya mereka, sehingga mereka dapat mencukurkan rambutnya; maka semua orang akan tahu, bahwa segala kabar yang mereka dengar tentang engkau sama sekali tidak benar, melainkan bahwa engkau tetap memelihara hukum Taurat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But concerning the Gentiles who believe, we have sent a letter with our decision: They should abstain from what has been sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from what has been strangled, and from sexual immorality.”

block.text: Tetapi mengenai bangsa-bangsa lain, yang telah menjadi percaya, sudah kami tuliskan keputusan-keputusan kami, yaitu mereka harus menjauhkan diri dari makanan yang dipersembahkan kepada berhala, dari darah, dari daging binatang yang mati dicekik dan dari percabulan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Paul took the men, and the next day, purified himself. He went with them into the temple, declaring the fulfillment of the days of purification, until the offering was offered for every one of them.

block.text: Pada hari berikutnya Paulus membawa orang-orang itu serta dengan dia, dan ia mentahirkan diri bersama-sama dengan mereka, lalu masuk ke Bait Allah untuk memberitahukan, bilamana pentahiran akan selesai dan persembahan akan dipersembahkan untuk mereka masing-masing.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the seven days were almost completed, the Jews from Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the multitude and laid hands on him,
crying out,

block.text: Ketika masa tujuh hari itu sudah hampir berakhir, orang-orang Yahudi yang datang dari Asia, melihat Paulus di dalam Bait Allah, lalu mereka menghasut rakyat dan menangkap dia,
sambil berteriak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men of Israel, help us! This is the man who teaches all men everywhere against the people, and the law, and this place.

block.text: <<Hai orang-orang Israel, tolong! Inilah orang yang di mana-mana mengajar semua orang untuk menentang bangsa kita dan menentang hukum Taurat dan tempat ini!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moreover, he also brought Greeks into the temple, and has defiled this holy place!”

block.text: Dan sekarang ia membawa orang-orang Yunani pula ke dalam Bait Allah dan menajiskan tempat suci ini!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they had seen Trophimus, the Ephesian, with him in the city, and they supposed that Paul had brought him into the temple.

block.text: Sebab mereka telah melihat Trofimus dari Efesus sebelumnya bersama-sama dengan Paulus di kota, dan mereka menyangka, bahwa Paulus telah membawa dia ke dalam Bait Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the city was moved, and the people ran together. They seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple. Immediately the doors were shut.

block.text: Maka gemparlah seluruh kota, dan rakyat datang berkerumun, lalu menangkap Paulus dan menyeretnya keluar dari Bait Allah dan seketika itu juga semua pintu gerbang Bait Allah itu ditutup.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were trying to kill him, news came up to the commanding officer of the regiment that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.

block.text: Sementara mereka merencanakan untuk membunuh dia, sampailah kabar kepada kepala pasukan, bahwa seluruh Yerusalem gempar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down to them. When they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.

block.text: Kepala pasukan itu segera bergerak dengan prajurit-prajurit dan perwira-perwira dan maju mendapatkan orang banyak itu. Ketika mereka melihat dia dan prajurit-prajurit itu, berhentilah mereka memukul Paulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the commanding officer came near, arrested him, commanded him to be bound with two chains. He inquired who he was and what he had done.

block.text: Kepala pasukan itu mendekati Paulus, menangkapnya dan menyuruh mengikat dia dengan dua rantai, lalu bertanya siapakah dia dan apakah yang telah diperbuatnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some shouted one thing, and some another, among the crowd. When he couldn't find out the truth because of the noise, he commanded him to be brought into the barracks.

block.text: Tetapi dari antara orang banyak itu ada yang meneriakkan kepadanya ini, ada pula yang meneriakkan itu. Dan oleh karena keributan itu ia tidak dapat mengetahui apakah yang sebenarnya terjadi. Sebab itu ia menyuruh membawa Paulus ke markas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came to the stairs, it happened that he was carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd;

block.text: Ketika sampai ke tangga Paulus terpaksa didukung prajurit-prajurit karena berdesak-desaknya orang banyak,

ReferenceBlocks.text: for the multitude of the people followed after, crying out,

block.text: yang berbondong-bondong mengikuti dia, sambil berteriak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Away with him!”

block.text: <<Enyahkanlah dia!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks, he asked the commanding officer,

block.text: Ketika Paulus hendak dibawa masuk ke markas, ia berkata kepada kepala pasukan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May I speak to you?”

block.text: <<Bolehkah aku mengatakan sesuatu kepadamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you know Greek?

block.text: <<Tahukah engkau bahasa Yunani?

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: Aren't you then the Egyptian, who before these days stirred up to sedition and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the Assassins?”

block.text: Jadi engkau bukan orang Mesir itu, yang baru-baru ini menimbulkan pemberontakan dan melarikan empat ribu orang pengacau bersenjata ke padang gurun?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said,

block.text: Paulus menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am a Jew, from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no insignificant city. I beg you, allow me to speak to the people.”

block.text: <<Aku adalah orang Yahudi, dari Tarsus, warga dari kota yang terkenal di Kilikia; aku minta, supaya aku diperbolehkan berbicara kepada orang banyak itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had given him permission, Paul, standing on the stairs, beckoned with his hand to the people. When there was a great silence, he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, saying,

block.text: Sesudah Paulus diperbolehkan oleh kepala pasukan, pergilah ia berdiri di tangga dan memberi isyarat dengan tangannya kepada rakyat itu; ketika suasana sudah tenang, mulailah ia berbicara kepada mereka dalam bahasa Ibrani, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 22
“Brothers and fathers, listen to the defense which I now make to you.”

block.text: <<Hai saudara-saudara dan bapa-bapa, dengarkanlah, apa yang hendak kukatakan kepadamu sebagai pembelaan diri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard that he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, they were even more quiet. He said,

block.text: Ketika orang banyak itu mendengar ia berbicara dalam bahasa Ibrani, makin tenanglah mereka. Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am indeed a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city. At the feet of Gamaliel, I was instructed according to the strict tradition of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as you all are this day.

block.text: <<Aku adalah orang Yahudi, lahir di Tarsus di tanah Kilikia, tetapi dibesarkan di kota ini; dididik dengan teliti di bawah pimpinan Gamaliel dalam hukum nenek moyang kita, sehingga aku menjadi seorang yang giat bekerja bagi Allah sama seperti kamu semua pada waktu ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

block.text: Dan aku telah menganiaya pengikut-pengikut Jalan Tuhan sampai mereka mati; laki-laki dan perempuan kutangkap dan kuserahkan ke dalam penjara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest and all the council of the elders testify. I even obtained letters from them to their brothers in Damascus, and I went there to bring these people as prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished.

block.text: Tentang hal itu baik Imam Besar maupun Majelis Tua-Tua dapat memberi kesaksian. Dari mereka aku telah membawa surat-surat untuk saudara-saudara di Damsyik dan aku telah pergi ke sana untuk menangkap penganut-penganut Jalan Tuhan, yang terdapat juga di situ dan membawa mereka ke Yerusalem untuk dihukum.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that, as I made my journey, and came close to Damascus, about noon, suddenly there shone from the sky a great light around me.

block.text: <<Tetapi dalam perjalananku ke sana, ketika aku sudah dekat Damsyik, yaitu waktu tengah hari, tiba-tiba memancarlah cahaya yang menyilaukan dari langit mengelilingi aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I fell to the ground, and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?’

block.text: Maka rebahlah aku ke tanah dan aku mendengar suatu suara yang berkata kepadaku: <Saulus, Saulus, mengapakah engkau menganiaya Aku?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I answered, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ He said to me, ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you persecute.’”

block.text: Jawabku: <Siapakah Engkau, Tuhan?> Kata-Nya: <Akulah Yesus, orang Nazaret, yang kauaniaya itu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Those who were with me indeed saw the light and were afraid, but they didn't understand the voice of him who spoke to me.

block.text: Dan mereka yang menyertai aku, memang melihat cahaya itu, tetapi suara Dia, yang berkata kepadaku, tidak mereka dengar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I said, ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ The Lord said to me, ‘Arise, and go into Damascus. There you will be told about all things which are appointed for you to do.’

block.text: <<Maka kataku: <Tuhan, apakah yang harus kuperbuat?> Kata Tuhan kepadaku: <Bangkitlah dan pergilah ke Damsyik. Di sana akan diberitahukan kepadamu segala sesuatu yang ditugaskan kepadamu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I couldn't see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of those who were with me, I came into Damascus.

block.text: Dan karena aku tidak dapat melihat oleh karena cahaya yang menyilaukan mata itu, maka kawan-kawan seperjalananku memegang tanganku dan menuntun aku ke Damsyik.>> <<

ReferenceBlocks.text: One Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews who lived in Damascus.

block.text: Di situ ada seorang bernama Ananias, seorang saleh yang menurut hukum Taurat dan terkenal baik di antara semua orang Yahudi yang ada di situ.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to me, and standing by me said to me, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight!’ In that very hour I looked up at him.

block.text: <<Ia datang berdiri di dekatku dan berkata: <Saulus, saudaraku, bukalah matamu dan melihatlah!> Dan seketika itu juga aku melihat kembali dan menatap dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘The God of our fathers has appointed you to know his will, and to see the Righteous One, and to hear a voice from his mouth.

block.text: Lalu katanya: <Allah nenek moyang kita telah menetapkan engkau untuk mengetahui kehendak-Nya, untuk melihat Yang Benar dan untuk mendengar suara yang keluar dari mulut-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you will be a witness for him to all men of what you have seen and heard.

block.text: Sebab engkau harus menjadi saksi-Nya terhadap semua orang tentang apa yang kaulihat dan yang kaudengar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now why do you wait? Arise, be baptized, and wash away your sins, calling on the name of the Lord.’”

block.text: Dan sekarang, mengapa engkau masih ragu-ragu? Bangunlah, berilah dirimu dibaptis dan dosa-dosamu disucikan sambil berseru kepada nama Tuhan!> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It happened that, when I had returned to Jerusalem, and while I prayed in the temple, I fell into a trance,

block.text: <<Sesudah aku kembali di Yerusalem dan ketika aku sedang berdoa di dalam Bait Allah, rohku diliputi oleh kuasa ilahi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I saw him saying to me, ‘Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly, because they will not receive testimony concerning me from you.’

block.text: Aku melihat Dia, yang berkata kepadaku: <Lekaslah, segeralah tinggalkan Yerusalem, sebab mereka tidak akan menerima kesaksianmu tentang Aku.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I said, ‘Lord, they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue those who believed in you.

block.text: Jawabku: <Tuhan, mereka tahu, bahwa akulah yang pergi dari rumah ibadat yang satu ke rumah ibadat yang lain dan yang memasukkan mereka yang percaya kepada-Mu ke dalam penjara dan menyesah mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the blood of Stephen, your witness, was shed, I also was there too. I consented to his death and guarded the cloaks of those who killed him.’”

block.text: Dan ketika darah Stefanus, saksi-Mu itu, ditumpahkan, aku ada di situ dan menyetujui perbuatan itu dan aku menjaga pakaian mereka yang membunuhnya.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to me, ‘Depart, for I will send you out far from here to the Gentiles.’”

block.text: Tetapi kata Tuhan kepadaku: <Pergilah, sebab Aku akan mengutus engkau jauh dari sini kepada bangsa-bangsa lain.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They listened to him until he said that; then they lifted up their voice, and said,

block.text: Rakyat mendengarkan Paulus sampai kepada perkataan itu; tetapi sesudah itu, mereka mulai berteriak, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rid the earth of this fellow, for he isn't fit to live!”

block.text: <<Enyahkan orang ini dari muka bumi! Ia tidak layak hidup!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cried out, and threw off their cloaks, and threw dust into the air.

block.text: Mereka terus berteriak sambil melemparkan jubah mereka dan menghamburkan debu ke udara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer commanded him to be brought into the barracks. He ordered him to be examined by scourging, that he might know for what crime they shouted against him.

block.text: Karena itu kepala pasukan memberi perintah untuk membawa Paulus ke markas dan menyesah dia, supaya dapat diketahui apa sebabnya orang banyak itu berteriak-teriak sedemikian terhadap dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had tied him up with thongs, Paul asked the centurion who stood by,

block.text: Tetapi ketika Paulus ditelentangkan untuk disesah, berkatalah ia kepada perwira yang bertugas:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman, and not found guilty?”

block.text: <<Bolehkah kamu menyesah seorang warganegara Rum, apalagi tanpa diadili?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the centurion heard it, he went to the commanding officer and told him,

block.text: Mendengar perkataan itu perwira itu melaporkannya kepada kepala pasukan, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Watch what you are about to do, for this man is a Roman!”

block.text: <<Apakah yang hendak engkau perbuat? Orang itu warganegara Rum.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer came and asked him,

block.text: Maka datanglah kepala pasukan itu kepada Paulus dan berkata:

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell me, are you a Roman?”

block.text: <<Katakanlah, benarkah engkau warganegara Rum?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawab Paulus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes.”

block.text: <<Benar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer answered,

block.text: Lalu kata kepala pasukan itu:

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “I bought my citizenship for a great price.”

block.text: <<Kewarganegaraan itu kubeli dengan harga yang mahal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul said,

block.text: Jawab Paulus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But I was born a Roman.”

block.text: <<Tetapi aku mempunyai hak itu karena kelahiranku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately those who were about to examine him departed from him. The commanding officer also was afraid when he realized that he was a Roman, because he had bound him.

block.text: Maka mereka yang harus menyesah dia, segera mundur; dan kepala pasukan itu juga takut, setelah ia tahu, bahwa Paulus, yang ia suruh ikat itu, adalah orang Rum.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But on the next day, He desired to know the truth about why he was accused by the Jews. So he freed him from the bonds, and commanded the chief priests and all the council to come together. Then he brought Paul down and set him before them.

block.text: Namun kepala pasukan itu ingin mengetahui dengan teliti apa yang dituduhkan orang-orang Yahudi kepada Paulus. Karena itu pada keesokan harinya ia menyuruh mengambil Paulus dari penjara dan memerintahkan, supaya imam-imam kepala dan seluruh Mahkamah Agama berkumpul. Lalu ia membawa Paulus dari markas dan menghadapkannya kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 23
Paul, looking steadfastly at the council, said,

block.text: Sambil menatap anggota-anggota Mahkamah Agama, Paulus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, I have lived before God in all good conscience until this day.”

block.text: <<Hai saudara-saudaraku, sampai kepada hari ini aku tetap hidup dengan hati nurani yang murni di hadapan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest, Ananias, commanded those who stood by him to
strike him on the mouth.
Then Paul said to him,

block.text: Tetapi Imam Besar Ananias menyuruh orang-orang yang berdiri dekat Paulus
menampar mulut Paulus.
Membalas itu Paulus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “God will strike you, you whitewashed wall! Do you sit to judge me according to the law, and command me to be struck contrary to the law?”

block.text: <<Allah akan menampar engkau, hai tembok yang dikapur putih-putih! Engkau duduk di sini untuk menghakimi aku menurut hukum Taurat, namun engkau melanggar hukum Taurat oleh perintahmu untuk menampar aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who stood by said,

block.text: Dan orang-orang yang hadir di situ berkata:

block.characterId: those standing near Paul in Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: those standing near Paul in Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you malign God's high priest?”

block.text: <<Engkau mengejek Imam Besar Allah?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul said,

block.text: Jawab Paulus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I didn't know, brothers, that he was high priest. For it is written, ‘You shall not speak evil of a ruler of your people.’”

block.text: <<Hai saudara-saudara, aku tidak tahu, bahwa ia adalah Imam Besar. Memang ada tertulis: <Janganlah engkau berkata jahat tentang seorang pemimpin bangsamu!> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council,

block.text: Dan karena ia tahu, bahwa sebagian dari mereka itu termasuk golongan orang Saduki dan sebagian termasuk golongan orang Farisi, ia berseru dalam Mahkamah Agama itu, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men and brothers, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees. Concerning the hope and resurrection of the dead I am being judged!”

block.text: <<Hai saudara-saudaraku, aku adalah orang Farisi, keturunan orang Farisi; aku dihadapkan ke Mahkamah ini, karena aku mengharap akan kebangkitan orang mati.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, an argument arose between the Pharisees and Sadducees, and the assembly was divided.

block.text: Ketika ia berkata demikian, timbullah perpecahan antara orang-orang Farisi dan orang-orang Saduki dan terbagi-bagilah orang banyak itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, nor angel, nor spirit; but the Pharisees confess all of these.

block.text: Sebab orang-orang Saduki mengatakan, bahwa tidak ada kebangkitan dan tidak ada malaikat atau roh, tetapi orang-orang Farisi mengakui kedua-duanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A great clamor arose, and some of the scribes of the Pharisees part stood up, and contended, saying,

block.text: Maka terjadilah keributan besar. Beberapa ahli Taurat dari golongan Farisi tampil ke depan dan membantah dengan keras, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We find no evil in this man. But if a spirit or angel has spoken to him, let's not fight against God!”

block.text: <<Kami sama sekali tidak menemukan sesuatu yang salah pada orang ini! Barangkali ada roh atau malaikat yang telah berbicara kepadanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When a great argument arose, the commanding officer feared that Paul would be torn in pieces by them. He commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them, and bring him into the barracks.

block.text: Maka terjadilah perpecahan besar, sehingga kepala pasukan takut, kalau-kalau mereka akan mengoyak-ngoyak Paulus. Karena itu ia memerintahkan pasukan untuk turun ke bawah dan mengambil Paulus dari tengah-tengah mereka dan membawanya ke markas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The following night, the Lord stood by him, and said,

block.text: Pada malam berikutnya Tuhan datang berdiri di sisinya dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cheer up, Paul, for as you have testified about me at Jerusalem, so you must testify also at Rome.”

block.text: <<Kuatkanlah hatimu, sebab sebagaimana engkau dengan berani telah bersaksi tentang Aku di Yerusalem, demikian jugalah hendaknya engkau pergi bersaksi di Roma.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was day, some of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul.

block.text: Dan setelah hari siang orang-orang Yahudi mengadakan komplotan dan bersumpah dengan mengutuk diri, bahwa mereka tidak akan makan atau minum, sebelum mereka membunuh Paulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were more than forty people who had made this conspiracy.

block.text: Jumlah mereka yang mengadakan komplotan itu lebih dari pada empat puluh orang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to the chief priests and the elders, and said,

block.text: Mereka pergi kepada imam-imam kepala dan tua-tua bangsa Yahudi dan berkata:

block.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy
ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have bound ourselves under a great curse, to taste nothing until we have killed Paul.

block.text: <<Kami telah bersumpah dengan mengutuk diri, bahwa kami tidak akan makan atau minum, sebelum kami membunuh Paulus.

block.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy
ReferenceBlocks.text: Now therefore, you with the council inform the commanding officer that he should bring him down to you tomorrow, as though you were going to judge his case more exactly.

block.text: Karena itu hendaklah kamu bersama-sama dengan Mahkamah Agama menganjurkan kepada kepala pasukan, supaya ia menghadapkan Paulus lagi kepada kamu, seolah-olah kamu hendak memeriksa perkaranya lebih teliti,

block.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews, more than forty in conspiracy
ReferenceBlocks.text: We are ready to kill him before he comes near.”

block.text: dan sementara itu kami sudah siap sedia untuk membunuh dia sebelum ia sampai kepada kamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul's nephew heard of their lying in wait. He came and entered into the barracks and told Paul.

block.text: Akan tetapi kemenakan Paulus, anak saudaranya perempuan, mendengar tentang penghadangan itu. Ia datang ke markas dan setelah diizinkan masuk, ia memberitahukannya kepada Paulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul summoned one of the centurions, and said,

block.text: Lalu Paulus memanggil salah seorang perwira dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Bring this young man to the commanding officer, for he has something to tell him.”

block.text: <<Bawalah anak ini kepada kepala pasukan, karena ada sesuatu yang perlu diberitahukannya kepadanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he took him, and brought him to the commanding officer, and said,

block.text: Perwira itu membawanya kepada kepala pasukan dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Paul, the prisoner, summoned me and asked me to bring this young man to you, who has something to tell you.”

block.text: <<Paulus orang tahanan itu, memanggil aku dan meminta, supaya aku membawa anak muda ini kepadamu, sebab ada yang perlu diberitahukannya kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer took him by the hand, and going aside, asked him privately,

block.text: Maka kepala pasukan itu memegang tangan anak muda itu, lalu membawanya ke samping dan bertanya:

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is it that you have to tell me?”

block.text: <<Apakah yang perlu kauberitahukan kepadaku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul down to the council tomorrow, as though intending to inquire somewhat more accurately concerning him.

block.text: <<Orang-orang Yahudi telah bersepakat untuk meminta kepadamu, supaya besok engkau menghadapkan Paulus lagi ke Mahkamah Agama, seolah-olah Mahkamah itu mau memperoleh keterangan yang lebih teliti dari padanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don't yield to them, for more than forty men lie in wait for him, who have bound themselves under a curse neither to eat nor to drink until they have killed him. Now they are ready, looking for the promise from you.”

block.text: Akan tetapi janganlah engkau mendengarkan mereka, sebab lebih dari pada empat puluh orang dari mereka telah siap untuk menghadang dia. Mereka telah bersumpah dengan mengutuk diri, bahwa mereka tidak akan makan atau minum, sebelum mereka membunuh dia; sekarang mereka telah siap sedia dan hanya menantikan keputusanmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the commanding officer let the young man go, charging him,

block.text: Lalu kepala pasukan menyuruh anak muda itu pulang dan memerintahkan kepadanya:

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one that you have revealed these things to me.”

block.text: <<Jangan katakan kepada siapapun juga, bahwa engkau telah memberitahukan hal ini kepadaku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called to himself two of the centurions, and said,

block.text: Kemudian kepala pasukan memanggil dua perwira dan berkata:

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Prepare two hundred soldiers to go as far as Caesarea, with seventy horsemen, and two hundred men armed with spears, at the third hour of the night.

block.text: <<Siapkan dua ratus orang prajurit untuk berangkat ke Kaisarea beserta tujuh puluh orang berkuda dan dua ratus orang bersenjata lembing, kira-kira pada jam sembilan malam ini.

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: Provide mounts for Paul to ride, and bring him safely to Felix the governor.”

block.text: Sediakan juga beberapa keledai tunggang untuk Paulus dan bawalah dia dengan selamat kepada wali negeri Feliks.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He wrote a letter like this:

block.text: Dan ia menulis surat, yang isinya sebagai berikut:

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Claudius Lysias to the most excellent governor Felix: Greetings.”

block.text: <<Salam dari Klaudius Lisias kepada wali negeri Feliks yang mulia.

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man was seized by the Jews, and was about to be killed by them. Then I came with the soldiers and rescued him, having learned that he was a Roman.

block.text: Orang ini ditangkap oleh orang-orang Yahudi dan ketika mereka hendak membunuhnya, aku datang dengan pasukan mencegahnya dan melepaskannya, karena aku dengar, bahwa ia adalah warganegara Roma.>>

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: Desiring to know the cause why they accused him, I brought him down to their council.

block.text: <<Untuk mengetahui apa alasannya mereka mendakwa dia, aku menghadapkannya ke Mahkamah Agama mereka.

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: I found him to be accused about questions of their law, but not to be charged with anything worthy of death or of imprisonment.

block.text: Ternyatalah bagiku, bahwa ia didakwa karena soal-soal hukum Taurat mereka, tetapi tidak ada tuduhan, atas mana ia patut dihukum mati atau dipenjarakan.

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: When I was told that the Jews lay in wait for the man, I sent him to you immediately. I also ordered his accusers to bring their accusations against him before you. Farewell.”

block.text: Ketika saya diberitahu bahwa orang-orang Yahudi berbaring di menunggu pria, saya mengirimnya ke Anda segera. Saya juga memerintahkan penuduhnya untuk membawa tuduhan mereka terhadap dia sebelum Anda. Perpisahan. "

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the soldiers, carrying out their orders, took Paul and brought him by night to Antipatris.

block.text: Lalu prajurit-prajurit itu mengambil Paulus sesuai dengan yang diperintahkan kepada mereka dan membawanya pada waktu malam ke Antipatris.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But on the next day they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the barracks.

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya mereka membiarkan orang-orang berkuda dan Paulus meneruskan perjalanan, dan mereka sendiri pulang ke markas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor, they also presented Paul to him.

block.text: Setibanya di Kaisarea orang-orang berkuda itu menyampaikan surat itu kepada wali negeri serta menyerahkan Paulus kepadanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the governor had read the letter, he asked Paul:

block.text: Dan setelah membaca surat itu, wali negeri itu menanyakan Paulus dari propinsi

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What province are you from?”

block.text: manakah asalnya. Dan ketika ia mendengar,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul replied:

block.text: bahwa Paulus

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am from Cilicia.”

block.text: dari Kilikia,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The governor said:

block.text: ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will hear you fully when your accusers also arrive.”

block.text: <<Aku akan memeriksa perkaramu, bila para pendakwamu juga telah tiba di sini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Felix commanded, saying:

block.text: Lalu ia menyuruh

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Keep him in Herod's palace.”

block.text: menahan Paulus di istana Herodes.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 24
After five days, the high priest, Ananias, came down with certain elders and an orator, one Tertullus. They informed the governor against Paul.

block.text: Lima hari kemudian datanglah Imam Besar Ananias bersama-sama dengan beberapa orang tua-tua dan seorang pengacara bernama Tertulus. Mereka menghadap wali negeri dan menyampaikan dakwaan mereka terhadap Paulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he was called, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying,

block.text: Paulus dipanggil menghadap dan Tertulus mulai mendakwa dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have enjoyed a long period of peace under you, and your foresight has brought about reforms in this nation.

block.text: <<Feliks yang mulia, oleh usahamu kami terus-menerus menikmati kesejahteraan, dan oleh kebijaksanaanmu banyak sekali perbaikan yang telah terlaksana untuk bangsa kami.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everywhere and in every way, most excellent Felix, we acknowledge this with profound gratitude.

block.text: Semuanya itu senantiasa dan di mana-mana kami sambut dengan sangat berterima kasih.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But, that I don't delay you, I entreat you to bear with us and hear a few words.

block.text: Akan tetapi supaya jangan terlalu banyak menghabiskan waktumu, aku minta, supaya engkau mendengarkan kami sebentar dengan kemurahan hatimu yang terkenal itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We have found this man to be a plague, an instigator of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes.

block.text: Telah nyata kepada kami, bahwa orang ini adalah penyakit sampar, seorang yang menimbulkan kekacauan di antara semua orang Yahudi di seluruh dunia yang beradab, dan bahwa ia adalah seorang tokoh dari sekte orang Nasrani.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He even tried to profane the temple, and we arrested him.

block.text: Malahan ia mencoba melanggar kekudusan Bait Allah. Oleh karena itu kami menangkap dia dan hendak menghakiminya menurut hukum Taurat kami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, and violently took him away out of our hands.

block.text: <<Tetapi kepala pasukan Lisias datang mencegahnya dan merebut dia dengan kekerasan dari tangan kami,

ReferenceBlocks.text: By examining him yourself you may ascertain all these things of which we accuse him.”

block.text: lalu menyuruh para pendakwa datang menghadap engkau. Jika engkau sendiri memeriksa dia, dapatlah engkau mengetahui segala sesuatu yang kami tuduhkan kepadanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews also joined in the attack, affirming that these things were so.

block.text: Dan juga orang-orang Yahudi menyokong dakwaan itu dengan mengatakan, bahwa perkara itu sungguh demikian.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the governor had beckoned to him to speak, Paul answered,

block.text: Lalu wali negeri itu memberi isyarat kepada Paulus, bahwa ia boleh berbicara. Maka berkatalah Paulus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because I know that you have been a judge of this nation for many years, I cheerfully make my defense.

block.text: <<Aku tahu, bahwa sudah bertahun-tahun lamanya engkau menjadi hakim atas bangsa ini. Karena itu tanpa ragu-ragu aku membela perkaraku ini di hadapanmu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: You can recognize that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to worship at Jerusalem.

block.text: Engkau dapat memastikan, bahwa tidak lebih dari dua belas hari yang lalu aku datang ke Yerusalem untuk beribadah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the temple they didn't find me disputing with anyone or stirring up a crowd, either in the synagogues, or in the city.

block.text: Dan tidak pernah orang mendapati aku sedang bertengkar dengan seseorang atau mengadakan huru-hara, baik di dalam Bait Allah, maupun di dalam rumah ibadat, atau di tempat lain di kota.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nor can they prove to you the things of which they now accuse me.

block.text: Dan mereka tidak dapat membuktikan kepadamu apa yang sekarang dituduhkan mereka kepada diriku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But this I confess to you, that after the Way, which they call heresy, so I serve the God of our fathers, believing all things which are according to the law, and which are written in the prophets.

block.text: <<Tetapi aku mengakui kepadamu, bahwa aku berbakti kepada Allah nenek moyang kami dengan menganut Jalan Tuhan, yaitu Jalan yang mereka sebut sekte. Aku percaya kepada segala sesuatu yang ada tertulis dalam hukum Taurat dan dalam kitab nabi-nabi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have the same hope toward God which these also themselves look for, that there will be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.

block.text: Aku menaruh pengharapan kepada Allah, sama seperti mereka juga, bahwa akan ada kebangkitan semua orang mati, baik orang-orang yang benar maupun orang-orang yang tidak benar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herein I also practice always having a conscience void of offense toward God and men.

block.text: Sebab itu aku senantiasa berusaha untuk hidup dengan hati nurani yang murni di hadapan Allah dan manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now after some years, I came to bring gifts for the needy to my nation, and offerings.

block.text: <<Dan setelah beberapa tahun lamanya aku datang kembali ke Yerusalem untuk membawa pemberian bagi bangsaku dan untuk mempersembahkan persembahan-persembahan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, not with a mob, nor with turmoil.

block.text: Sementara aku melakukan semuanya itu, beberapa orang Yahudi dari Asia mendapati aku di dalam Bait Allah, sesudah aku selesai mentahirkan diriku, tanpa orang banyak dan tanpa keributan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ought to have been here before you, and to make accusation, if they had anything against me.

block.text: Merekalah yang sebenarnya harus menghadap engkau di sini dan mengajukan dakwaan mereka, jika mereka mempunyai sesuatu terhadap aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or else let these men themselves say what injustice they found in me when I stood before the council --

block.text: Namun biarlah orang-orang yang hadir di sini sekarang menyatakan kejahatan apakah yang mereka dapati, ketika aku dihadapkan di Mahkamah Agama.

ReferenceBlocks.text: unless it is for this one thing that I cried standing among them, ‘Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged before you today!’”

block.text: Atau mungkinkah karena satu-satunya perkataan yang aku serukan, ketika aku berdiri di tengah-tengah mereka, yakni: <Karena hal kebangkitan orang-orang mati, aku hari ini dihadapkan kepada kamu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Felix, having more exact knowledge concerning the Way, deferred them, saying,

block.text: Tetapi Feliks yang tahu benar-benar akan Jalan Tuhan, menangguhkan perkara mereka, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When Lysias, the commanding officer, comes down, I will decide your case.”

block.text: <<Setibanya kepala pasukan Lisias di sini, aku akan mengambil keputusan dalam perkaramu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He ordered the centurion that Paul should be kept in custody, and should have some privileges, and not to forbid any of his friends to serve him or to visit him.

block.text: Lalu ia menyuruh perwira itu tetap menahan Paulus, tetapi dengan tahanan ringan, dan tidak boleh mencegah sahabat-sahabatnya melayani dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But after some days, Felix came with Drusilla, his wife, who was a Jewess. He sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ Jesus.

block.text: Dan setelah beberapa hari datanglah Feliks bersama-sama dengan isterinya Drusila, seorang Yahudi; ia menyuruh memanggil Paulus, lalu mendengar dari padanya tentang kepercayaan kepada Yesus Kristus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he reasoned about righteousness, self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered,

block.text: Tetapi ketika Paulus berbicara tentang kebenaran, penguasaan diri dan penghakiman yang akan datang, Feliks menjadi takut dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way for this time, and when it is convenient for me, I will summon you.”

block.text: <<Cukuplah dahulu dan pergilah sekarang; apabila ada kesempatan baik, aku akan menyuruh memanggil engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Meanwhile, he also hoped that money would be given to him by Paul, that he might release him. Therefore also he sent for him more often, and talked with him.

block.text: Sementara itu ia berharap, bahwa Paulus akan memberikan uang kepadanya. Karena itu ia sering memanggilnya untuk bercakap-cakap dengan dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when two years were fulfilled, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus. Felix desired to gain favor with the Jews, so he left Paul in bonds.

block.text: Tetapi sesudah genap dua tahun, Feliks digantikan oleh Perkius Festus, dan untuk mengambil hati orang Yahudi, ia membiarkan Paulus tetap dalam penjara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 25
Festus therefore, having come into the province, after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea.

block.text: Tiga hari sesudah tiba di propinsi itu berangkatlah Festus dari Kaisarea ke Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the high priest and the principal men of the Jews informed him against Paul.

block.text: Di situ imam-imam kepala dan orang-orang Yahudi yang terkemuka datang menghadap dia dan menyampaikan dakwaan terhadap Paulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked Festus for a favor against him, that he would summon him to Jerusalem; plotting to kill him on the way.
However Festus answered saying:

block.text: Kepadanya mereka meminta suatu anugerah, yang merugikan Paulus, yaitu untuk menyuruh Paulus datang ke Yerusalem. Sebab mereka sedang membuat rencana untuk membunuh dia di tengah jalan.
Tetapi Festus menjawab,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Paul is being held at Caesarea, and I myself am going there soon.

block.text: bahwa Paulus tetap ditahan di Kaisarea dan bahwa ia sendiri bermaksud untuk segera kembali ke sana.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let some of your leaders come with me and press charges against him there, if he has done anything wrong.”

block.text: Katanya: <<Karena itu baiklah orang-orang yang berwewenang di antara kamu turut ke sana bersama-sama dengan aku dan mengajukan dakwaan terhadap dia, jika ada kesalahannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had stayed among them more than ten days, he went down to Caesarea. On the next day he sat on the judgment seat, and commanded Paul to be brought.

block.text: Festus tinggal tidak lebih dari pada delapan atau sepuluh hari di Yerusalem. Sesudah itu ia pulang ke Kaisarea. Pada keesokan harinya ia mengadakan sidang pengadilan, dan menyuruh menghadapkan Paulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing against him many and grievous charges which they could not prove.

block.text: Sesudah Paulus tiba di situ, semua orang Yahudi yang datang dari Yerusalem berdiri mengelilinginya dan mereka mengemukakan banyak tuduhan berat terhadap dia yang tidak dapat mereka buktikan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul defended himself saying,

block.text: Sebaliknya Paulus membela diri, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Caesar, have I sinned at all.”

block.text: <<Aku sedikitpun tidak bersalah, baik terhadap hukum Taurat orang Yahudi maupun terhadap Bait Allah atau terhadap Kaisar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Festus, desiring to gain favor with the Jews, answered Paul and said,

block.text: Tetapi Festus yang hendak mengambil hati orang Yahudi, menjawab Paulus, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem, and be judged by me there concerning these things?”

block.text: <<Apakah engkau bersedia pergi ke Yerusalem, supaya engkau dihakimi di sana di hadapanku tentang perkara ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said,

block.text: Tetapi kata Paulus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am standing before Caesar's judgment seat, where I ought to be tried.

block.text: <<Aku sekarang berdiri di sini di hadapan pengadilan Kaisar dan di sinilah aku harus dihakimi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have done no wrong to the Jews, as you also know very well.

block.text: Seperti engkau sendiri tahu benar-benar, sedikitpun aku tidak berbuat salah terhadap orang Yahudi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if I have done wrong, and have committed anything worthy of death, I don't refuse to die. But if none of those things is true that they accuse me of, no one can give me up to them. I appeal to Caesar!”

block.text: Jadi, jika aku benar-benar bersalah dan berbuat sesuatu kejahatan yang setimpal dengan hukuman mati, aku rela mati, tetapi, jika apa yang mereka tuduhkan itu terhadap aku ternyata tidak benar, tidak ada seorangpun yang berhak menyerahkan aku sebagai suatu anugerah kepada mereka. Aku naik banding kepada Kaisar!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered,

block.text: Setelah berunding dengan anggota-anggota pengadilan, Festus menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have appealed to Caesar. To Caesar you shall go.”

block.text: <<Engkau telah naik banding kepada Kaisar, jadi engkau harus pergi menghadap Kaisar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when some days had passed, King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea, and greeted Festus.

block.text: Beberapa hari kemudian datanglah raja Agripa dengan Bernike ke Kaisarea untuk mengadakan kunjungan kehormatan kepada Festus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he stayed there many days, Festus laid Paul's case before the king, saying,

block.text: Karena mereka beberapa hari lamanya tinggal di situ, Festus memaparkan perkara Paulus kepada raja itu, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There is a certain man here whom Felix left as a prisoner.

block.text: <<Di sini ada seorang tahanan yang ditinggalkan Feliks pada waktu ia pergi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I went to Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews brought charges against him and asked that he be condemned.

block.text: Ketika aku berada di Yerusalem, imam-imam kepala dan tua-tua orang Yahudi mengajukan dakwaan terhadap orang itu dan meminta supaya ia dihukum.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I said to them that it is not the custom of the Romans to give up any man to destruction, before the accused has met the accusers face to face, and has had opportunity to make his defense concerning the matter laid against him.

block.text: Aku menjawab mereka, bahwa bukanlah kebiasaan pada orang-orang Roma untuk menyerahkan seorang terdakwa sebagai suatu anugerah sebelum ia dihadapkan dengan orang-orang yang menuduhnya dan diberi kesempatan untuk membela diri terhadap tuduhan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore they had come together here, I didn't delay, but on the next day sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought.

block.text: Karena itu mereka turut bersama-sama dengan aku ke mari. Pada keesokan harinya aku segera mengadakan sidang pengadilan dan menyuruh menghadapkan orang itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Concerning whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no charge of such things as I supposed.

block.text: <<Tetapi ketika para pendakwa berdiri di sekelilingnya, mereka tidak mengajukan suatu tuduhanpun tentang perbuatan jahat seperti yang telah aku duga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they had certain questions against him about their own religion, and about one Jesus, who was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.

block.text: Tetapi mereka hanya berselisih paham dengan dia tentang soal-soal agama mereka, dan tentang seorang bernama Yesus, yang sudah mati, sedangkan Paulus katakan dengan pasti, bahwa Ia hidup.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being perplexed how to inquire concerning these things, I asked whether he was willing to go to Jerusalem and there be judged concerning these matters.

block.text: Karena aku ragu-ragu bagaimana aku harus memeriksa perkara-perkara seperti itu, aku menanyakan apakah ia mau pergi ke Yerusalem, supaya perkaranya dihakimi di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Paul had appealed to be kept for the decision of the emperor, I commanded him to be kept until I could send him to Caesar.”

block.text: Tetapi Paulus naik banding. Ia minta, supaya ia tinggal dalam tahanan dan menunggu, sampai perkaranya diputuskan oleh Kaisar. Karena itu aku menyuruh menahan dia sampai aku dapat mengirim dia kepada Kaisar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Agrippa said to Festus,

block.text: Kata Agripa kepada Festus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I also would like to hear the man myself.”

block.text: <<Aku ingin mendengar orang itu sendiri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tomorrow,”

block.text: <<Besok

ReferenceBlocks.text: he said,

block.text: Jawab Festus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “you shall hear him.”

block.text: engkau akan mendengar dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So on the next day, Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp, and they entered into the place of hearing with the commanding officers and principal men of the city. At the command of Festus, Paul was brought in.
Festus said,

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya datanglah Agripa dan Bernike dengan segala kebesaran dan sesudah mereka masuk ruang pengadilan bersama-sama dengan kepala-kepala pasukan dan orang-orang yang terkemuka dari kota itu, Festus memberi perintah, supaya Paulus dihadapkan.
Festus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “King Agrippa, and all men who are here present with us, you see this man. All the multitude of the Jews petitioned me, both at Jerusalem and here. They shouted that he ought not to live any longer.

block.text: <<Ya raja Agripa serta semua yang hadir di sini bersama-sama dengan kami. Lihatlah orang ini, yang dituduh oleh semua orang Yahudi, baik yang di Yerusalem, maupun yang di sini. Mereka telah datang kepadaku dan sambil berteriak-teriak mereka mengatakan, bahwa ia tidak boleh hidup lebih lama.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him.

block.text: Tetapi ternyata kepadaku, bahwa ia tidak berbuat sesuatupun yang setimpal dengan hukuman mati dan karena ia naik banding kepada Kaisar, aku memutuskan untuk mengirim dia menghadap Kaisar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I have nothing definite to write to my lord. Therefore I have brought him forth before you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, that, after examination, I may have something to write.

block.text: <<Tetapi tidak ada apa-apa yang pasti yang harus kutulis kepada Kaisar tentang dia. Itulah sebabnya aku menghadapkan dia di sini kepada kamu semua, terutama kepadamu, raja Agripa, supaya, setelah diadakan pemeriksaan, aku dapat menuliskan sesuatu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it seems to me unreasonable, in sending a prisoner, not to also specify the charges against him.”

block.text: Sebab pada hematku tidaklah wajar untuk mengirim seorang tahanan dengan tidak menyatakan tuduhan-tuduhan yang diajukan terhadap dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 26
Agrippa said to Paul,

block.text: Kata Agripa kepada Paulus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You may speak for yourself.”

block.text: <<Engkau diberi kesempatan untuk membela diri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Paul stretched out his hand, and made his defense.

block.text: Paulus memberi isyarat dengan tangannya, lalu memberi pembelaannya seperti berikut:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I think myself happy, King Agrippa, that I am to make my defense before you this day concerning all the things that I am accused of by the Jews,

block.text: <<Ya raja Agripa, aku merasa berbahagia, karena pada hari ini aku diperkenankan untuk memberi pertanggungan jawab di hadapanmu terhadap segala tuduhan yang diajukan orang-orang Yahudi terhadap diriku,

ReferenceBlocks.text: especially because you are expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews. Therefore I beg you to hear me patiently.”

block.text: terutama karena engkau tahu benar-benar adat istiadat dan persoalan orang Yahudi. Sebab itu aku minta kepadamu, supaya engkau mendengarkan aku dengan sabar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Indeed, all the Jews know my way of life from my youth up, which was from the beginning among my own nation and at Jerusalem.

block.text: <<Semua orang Yahudi mengetahui jalan hidupku sejak masa mudaku, sebab dari semula aku hidup di tengah-tengah bangsaku di Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If they are willing to testify, they would say that I lived my life after the strictest sect of our religion. I was a Pharisee.

block.text: Sudah lama mereka mengenal aku dan sekiranya mereka mau, mereka dapat memberi kesaksian, bahwa aku telah hidup sebagai seorang Farisi menurut mazhab yang paling keras dalam agama kita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made by God to our fathers.

block.text: Sekarang saya berdiri di sini untuk dihakimi atas harapan janji yang diberikan oleh Allah kepada nenek moyang kita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Our twelve tribes, earnestly serving night and day, hoped to attain this promise. Concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, King Agrippa!

block.text: dua belas suku kami, sungguh-sungguh melayani siang dan malam, berharap untuk mencapai janji ini. Mengenai harapan ini aku dituduh oleh orang Yahudi, Raja Agripa!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why is it judged incredible with you, if God does raise the dead?”

block.text: Mengapa kamu menganggap mustahil, bahwa Allah membangkitkan orang mati?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I myself most certainly thought that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

block.text: <<Bagaimanapun juga, aku sendiri pernah menyangka, bahwa aku harus keras bertindak menentang nama Yesus dari Nazaret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This I also did in Jerusalem. I both shut up many of the saints in prisons, having received authority from the chief priests. And when they were put to death I gave my vote against them.

block.text: Hal itu kulakukan juga di Yerusalem. Aku bukan saja telah memasukkan banyak orang kudus ke dalam penjara, setelah aku memperoleh kuasa dari imam-imam kepala, tetapi aku juga setuju, jika mereka dihukum mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Punishing them often in all the synagogues, I tried to make them blaspheme. Being exceedingly enraged against them, I persecuted them even to foreign cities.”

block.text: Dalam rumah-rumah ibadat aku sering menyiksa mereka dan memaksanya untuk menyangkal imannya dan dalam amarah yang meluap-luap aku mengejar mereka, bahkan sampai ke kota-kota asing.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I was traveling to Damascus with the authority and commission from the chief priests.

block.text: "Saya sedang melakukan perjalanan ke Damaskus dengan wewenang dan komisi dari imam-imam kepala.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At noon, O king, I saw on the way a light from the sky, brighter than the sun, shining around me and those who traveled with me.

block.text: Pada tengah hari, ya raja, sesungguhnya aku melihat dalam perjalanan cahaya dari langit, lebih terang dari matahari, bersinar di sekitar saya dan mereka yang bepergian dengan saya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew language, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.’”

block.text: Kami semua rebah ke tanah dan aku mendengar suatu suara yang mengatakan kepadaku dalam bahasa Ibrani: <Saulus, Saulus, mengapa engkau menganiaya Aku? Sukar bagimu menendang ke galah rangsang.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I said, ‘Who are you, Lord?’” “He said, ‘I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.

block.text: <<Tetapi aku menjawab: <Siapa Engkau, Tuhan?> Kata Tuhan: <Akulah Yesus, yang kauaniaya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But arise, and stand on your feet, for I have appeared to you for this purpose: to appoint you a servant and a witness both of the things which you have seen, and of the things which I will reveal to you.

block.text: Tetapi sekarang, bangunlah dan berdirilah. Aku menampakkan diri kepadamu untuk menetapkan engkau menjadi pelayan dan saksi tentang segala sesuatu yang telah kaulihat dari pada-Ku dan tentang apa yang akan Kuperlihatkan kepadamu nanti.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will keep you safe from the jews and from the Gentiles, to whom I send you.

block.text: Aku akan mengasingkan engkau dari bangsa ini dan dari bangsa-bangsa lain. Dan Aku akan mengutus engkau kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are to open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God. In this way they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’”

block.text: untuk membuka mata mereka, supaya mereka berbalik dari kegelapan kepada terang dan dari kuasa Iblis kepada Allah, supaya mereka oleh iman mereka kepada-Ku memperoleh pengampunan dosa dan mendapat bagian dalam apa yang ditentukan untuk orang-orang yang dikuduskan.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision.

block.text: <<Sebab itu, ya raja Agripa, kepada penglihatan yang dari sorga itu tidak pernah aku tidak taat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I declared first to them of Damascus, at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judea, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance.

block.text: Tetapi mula-mula aku memberitakan kepada orang-orang Yahudi di Damsyik, di Yerusalem dan di seluruh tanah Yudea, dan juga kepada bangsa-bangsa lain, bahwa mereka harus bertobat dan berbalik kepada Allah serta melakukan pekerjaan-pekerjaan yang sesuai dengan pertobatan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this reason the Jews seized me in the temple, and tried to kill me.

block.text: Karena itulah orang-orang Yahudi menangkap aku di Bait Allah, dan mencoba membunuh aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand to this day testifying both to small and great. I say nothing but what the prophets and Moses said would happen.

block.text: <<Tetapi oleh pertolongan Allah aku dapat hidup sampai sekarang dan memberi kesaksian kepada orang-orang kecil dan orang-orang besar. Dan apa yang kuberitakan itu tidak lain dari pada yang sebelumnya telah diberitahukan oleh para nabi dan juga oleh Musa,

ReferenceBlocks.text: I explained how the Christ must suffer, and how, by the resurrection of the dead, he would be first to proclaim light both to these people and to the Gentiles.”

block.text: yaitu, bahwa Mesias harus menderita sengsara dan bahwa Ia adalah yang pertama yang akan bangkit dari antara orang mati, dan bahwa Ia akan memberitakan terang kepada bangsa ini dan kepada bangsa-bangsa lain.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he thus made his defense, Festus said with a loud voice,

block.text: Sementara Paulus mengemukakan semuanya itu untuk mempertanggungjawabkan pekerjaannya, berkatalah Festus dengan suara keras:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Paul, you are crazy! Your great learning is driving you insane!”

block.text: <<Engkau gila, Paulus! Ilmumu yang banyak itu membuat engkau gila.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said,

block.text: Tetapi Paulus menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am not crazy, most excellent Festus, but boldly declare words of truth and reasonableness.

block.text: <<Aku tidak gila, Festus yang mulia! Aku mengatakan kebenaran dengan pikiran yang sehat!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the king knows of these things, to whom also I speak freely. For I am persuaded that none of these things is hidden from him, for this has not been done in a corner.

block.text: Raja juga tahu tentang segala perkara ini, sebab itu aku berani berbicara terus terang kepadanya. Aku yakin, bahwa tidak ada sesuatupun dari semuanya ini yang belum didengarnya, karena perkara ini tidak terjadi di tempat yang terpencil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know that you believe.”

block.text: Percayakah engkau, raja Agripa, kepada para nabi? Aku tahu, bahwa engkau percaya kepada mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Agrippa said to Paul,

block.text: Jawab Agripa:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “With a little persuasion are you trying to make me a Christian?”

block.text: <<Hampir-hampir saja kauyakinkan aku menjadi orang Kristen!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul said,

block.text: Kata Paulus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I pray to God, that whether with little or with much, not only you, but also all that hear me this day, might become such as I am, except for these bonds.”

block.text: <<Aku mau berdoa kepada Allah, supaya segera atau lama-kelamaan bukan hanya engkau saja, tetapi semua orang lain yang hadir di sini dan yang mendengarkan perkataanku menjadi sama seperti aku, kecuali belenggu-belenggu ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The king rose up with the governor, and Bernice, and those who sat with them.

block.text: Lalu bangkitlah raja dan wali negeri serta Bernike dan semua orang yang duduk bersama-sama mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had withdrawn, they spoke one to another, saying,

block.text: Sementara mereka keluar, mereka berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

block.characterId: King Herod Agrippa II/Festus, governor of Judea/Bernice

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: King Herod Agrippa II/Festus, governor of Judea/Bernice
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man does nothing worthy of death or of bonds.”

block.text: <<Orang itu tidak melakukan sesuatu yang setimpal dengan hukuman mati atau hukuman penjara.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Agrippa said to Festus,

block.text: Kata Agripa kepada Festus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man might have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar.”

block.text: <<Orang itu sebenarnya sudah dapat dibebaskan sekiranya ia tidak naik banding kepada Kaisar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 27
When it was determined that we should sail for Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius, of the Augustan band.

block.text: Setelah diputuskan, bahwa kami akan berlayar ke Italia, maka Paulus dan beberapa orang tahanan lain diserahkan kepada seorang perwira yang bernama Yulius dari pasukan Kaisar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Embarking in a ship of Adramyttium, which was about to sail to places on the coast of Asia, we put to sea. Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica was with us.

block.text: Kami naik ke sebuah kapal dari Adramitium yang akan berangkat ke pelabuhan-pelabuhan di sepanjang pantai Asia, lalu kami bertolak. Aristarkhus, seorang Makedonia dari Tesalonika, menyertai kami.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The next day, we touched at Sidon. Julius treated Paul kindly, and gave him permission to go to his friends and refresh himself.

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya kami singgah di Sidon. Yulius memperlakukan Paulus dengan ramah dan memperbolehkannya mengunjungi sahabat-sahabatnya, supaya mereka melengkapkan keperluannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Putting to sea from there, we sailed under the lee of Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.

block.text: Oleh karena angin sakal kami berlayar dari situ menyusur pantai Siprus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had sailed across the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.

block.text: Dan setelah mengarungi laut di depan Kilikia dan Pamfilia, sampailah kami di Mira, di daerah Likia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us on board.

block.text: Di situ perwira kami menemukan sebuah kapal dari Aleksandria yang hendak berlayar ke Italia. Ia memindahkan kami ke kapal itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had sailed slowly many days, and had come with difficulty opposite Cnidus, the wind not allowing us further, we sailed under the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone.

block.text: Selama beberapa hari berlayar, kami hampir-hampir tidak maju dan dengan susah payah kami mendekati Knidus. Karena angin tetap tidak baik, kami menyusur pantai Kreta melewati tanjung Salmone.

ReferenceBlocks.text: With difficulty sailing along it we came to a certain place called Fair Havens, near the city of Lasea.

block.text: Sesudah kami dengan susah payah melewati tanjung itu, sampailah kami di sebuah tempat bernama Pelabuhan Indah, dekat kota Lasea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When much time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous, because the Fast had now already gone by, Paul admonished them,
and said to them,

block.text: Sementara itu sudah banyak waktu yang hilang. Waktu puasa sudah lampau dan sudah berbahaya untuk melanjutkan pelayaran. Sebab itu Paulus memperingatkan mereka, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sirs, I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss, not only of the cargo and the ship, but also of our lives.”

block.text: <<Saudara-saudara, aku lihat, bahwa pelayaran kita akan mendatangkan kesukaran-kesukaran dan kerugian besar, bukan saja bagi muatan dan kapal, tetapi juga bagi nyawa kita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship than to those things which were spoken by Paul.

block.text: Tetapi perwira itu lebih percaya kepada jurumudi dan nakhoda dari pada kepada perkataan Paulus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because the haven was not suitable to winter in, the majority advised going to sea from there, if by any means they could reach Phoenix, and winter there. This was a port of Crete, looking northwest and southwest.

block.text: Karena pelabuhan itu tidak baik untuk tinggal di situ selama musim dingin, maka kebanyakan dari mereka lebih setuju untuk berlayar terus dan mencoba mencapai kota Feniks untuk tinggal di situ selama musim dingin. Kota Feniks adalah sebuah pelabuhan pulau Kreta, yang terbuka ke arah barat daya dan ke arah barat laut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the south wind blew softly, they supposed that they had obtained their purpose. They weighed anchor and sailed along Crete, close to shore.

block.text: Pada waktu itu angin sepoi-sepoi bertiup dari selatan. Mereka menyangka, bahwa maksud mereka sudah tentu akan tercapai. Mereka membongkar sauh, lalu berlayar dekat sekali menyusur pantai Kreta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But before long, a stormy wind beat down from shore, which is called Euroclydon.

block.text: Tetapi tidak berapa lama kemudian turunlah dari arah pulau itu angin badai, yang disebut angin <<Timur Laut>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the ship was caught, and couldn't face the wind,
we gave way to it, and were driven along.

block.text: Kapal itu dilandanya dan tidak tahan menghadapi angin
haluan. Karena itu kami menyerah saja dan membiarkan kapal kami terombang-ambing.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Running under the lee of a small island called Clauda, we were able, with difficulty, to secure the boat.

block.text: Kemudian kami hanyut sampai ke pantai sebuah pulau kecil bernama Kauda, dan di situ dengan susah payah kami dapat menguasai sekoci kapal itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After they had hoisted it up, they used cables to help reinforce the ship. Fearing that they would run aground on the Syrtis sand bars, they lowered the sea anchor, and so were driven along.

block.text: Dan setelah sekoci itu dinaikkan ke atas kapal, mereka memasang alat-alat penolong dengan meliliti kapal itu dengan tali. Dan karena takut terdampar di beting Sirtis, mereka menurunkan layar dan membiarkan kapal itu terapung-apung saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As we labored exceedingly with the storm, the next day they began to throw things overboard.

block.text: Karena kami sangat hebat diombang-ambingkan angin badai, maka pada keesokan harinya mereka mulai membuang muatan kapal ke laut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the third day, they threw out the ship's tackle with their own hands.

block.text: Dan pada hari yang ketiga mereka membuang alat-alat kapal dengan tangan mereka sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When neither sun nor stars shone on us for many days, and no small storm pressed on us, all hope that we would be saved was now taken away.

block.text: Setelah beberapa hari lamanya baik matahari maupun bintang-bintang tidak kelihatan, dan angin badai yang dahsyat terus-menerus mengancam kami, akhirnya putuslah segala harapan kami untuk dapat menyelamatkan diri kami.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had been long without food, Paul stood up in the middle of them, and said,

block.text: Dan karena mereka beberapa lamanya tidak makan, berdirilah Paulus di tengah-tengah mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sirs, you should have listened to me, and not have set sail from Crete, and have gotten this injury and loss.

block.text: <<Saudara-saudara, jika sekiranya nasihatku dituruti, supaya kita jangan berlayar dari Kreta, kita pasti terpelihara dari kesukaran dan kerugian ini!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now I exhort you to cheer up, for there will be no loss of life among you, but only of the ship.

block.text: Tetapi sekarang, juga dalam kesukaran ini, aku menasihatkan kamu, supaya kamu tetap bertabah hati, sebab tidak seorangpun di antara kamu yang akan binasa, kecuali kapal ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there stood by me this night an angel, belonging to the God whose I am and whom I serve.

block.text: Karena tadi malam seorang malaikat dari Allah, yaitu dari Allah yang aku sembah sebagai milik-Nya, berdiri di sisiku,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘Don't be afraid, Paul. You must stand before Caesar. Behold, God has granted you all those who sail with you.’

block.text: dan ia berkata: <Jangan takut, Paulus! Engkau harus menghadap Kaisar; dan sesungguhnya oleh karunia Allah, maka semua orang yang ada bersama-sama dengan engkau di kapal ini akan selamat karena engkau.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, sirs, cheer up! For I believe God, that it will be just as it has been spoken to me.

block.text: Sebab itu tabahkanlah hatimu, saudara-saudara! Karena aku percaya kepada Allah, bahwa semuanya pasti terjadi sama seperti yang dinyatakan kepadaku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we must run aground on a certain island.”

block.text: Namun kita harus mendamparkan kapal ini di salah satu pulau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the fourteenth night had come, we were driven back and forth in the Adriatic Sea. About midnight the sailors surmised that they were drawing near to some land.

block.text: Malam yang keempat belas sudah tiba dan kami masih tetap terombang-ambing di laut Adria. Tetapi kira-kira tengah malam anak-anak kapal merasa, bahwa mereka telah dekat daratan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took soundings, and found twenty fathoms. After a little while, they took soundings again, and found fifteen fathoms.

block.text: Lalu mereka mengulurkan batu duga, dan ternyata air di situ dua puluh depa dalamnya. Setelah maju sedikit mereka menduga lagi dan ternyata lima belas depa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Fearing that we would run aground on rocky ground, they let go four anchors from the stern, and wished for daylight.

block.text: Dan karena takut, bahwa kami akan terkandas di salah satu batu karang, mereka membuang empat sauh di buritan, dan kami sangat berharap mudah-mudahan hari lekas siang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sailors were trying to flee out of the ship, and had lowered the boat into the sea, pretending that they would lay out anchors from the bow.

block.text: Akan tetapi anak-anak kapal berusaha untuk melarikan diri dari kapal. Mereka menurunkan sekoci, dan berbuat seolah-olah mereka hendak melabuhkan beberapa sauh di haluan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers,

block.text: Karena itu Paulus berkata kepada perwira dan prajurit-prajuritnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unless these stay in the ship, you can't be saved.”

block.text: <<Jika mereka tidak tinggal di kapal, kamu tidak mungkin selamat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat, and let it fall off.

block.text: Lalu prajurit-prajurit itu memotong tali sekoci dan membiarkannya hanyut.
