ReferenceBlocks.text: While the day was coming on, Paul begged them all to take some food, saying,

block.text: Ketika hari menjelang siang, Paulus mengajak semua orang untuk makan, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This day is the fourteenth day that you wait and continue fasting, having taken nothing.

block.text: <<Sudah empat belas hari lamanya kamu menanti-nanti saja, menahan lapar dan tidak makan apa-apa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I beg you to take some food, for this is for your safety. Not a hair will perish from any of your heads.”

block.text: Karena itu aku menasihati kamu, supaya kamu makan dahulu. Hal itu perlu untuk keselamatanmu. Tidak seorangpun di antara kamu akan kehilangan sehelaipun dari rambut kepalanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, and had taken bread, he gave thanks to God in the presence of all, and he broke it, and began to eat.

block.text: Sesudah berkata demikian, ia mengambil roti, mengucap syukur kepada Allah di hadapan semua mereka, memecah-mecahkannya, lalu mulai makan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they all cheered up, and they also took food.

block.text: Maka kuatlah hati semua orang itu, dan merekapun makan juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In all, we were two hundred seventy-six souls on the ship.

block.text: Jumlah kami semua yang di kapal itu dua ratus tujuh puluh enam jiwa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea.

block.text: Setelah makan kenyang, mereka membuang muatan gandum ke laut untuk meringankan kapal itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was day, they didn't recognize the land, but they noticed a certain bay with a beach. They decided to try to drive the ship onto it.

block.text: Dan ketika hari mulai siang, mereka melihat suatu teluk yang rata pantainya. Walaupun mereka tidak mengenal daratan itu, mereka memutuskan untuk sedapat mungkin mendamparkan kapal itu ke situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Casting off the anchors, they left them in the sea, at the same time untying the rudder ropes. Hoisting up the foresail to the wind, they made for the beach.

block.text: Mereka melepaskan tali-tali sauh, lalu meninggalkan sauh-sauh itu di dasar laut. Sementara itu mereka mengulurkan tali-tali kemudi, memasang layar topang, supaya angin meniup kapal itu menuju pantai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But coming to a place where two seas met, they ran the vessel aground. The bow struck and remained immovable, but the stern began to break up by the violence of the waves.

block.text: Tetapi mereka melanggar busung pasir, dan terkandaslah kapal itu. Haluannya terpancang dan tidak dapat bergerak dan buritannya hancur dipukul oleh gelombang yang hebat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The soldiers’ counsel was to kill the prisoners, so that none of them would swim out and escape.

block.text: Pada waktu itu prajurit-prajurit bermaksud untuk membunuh tahanan-tahanan, supaya jangan ada seorangpun yang melarikan diri dengan berenang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the centurion, desiring to save Paul, stopped them from their purpose. He commanded that those who could swim should throw themselves overboard first to go toward the land.

block.text: Tetapi perwira itu ingin menyelamatkan Paulus. Karena itu ia menggagalkan maksud mereka, dan memerintahkan, supaya orang-orang yang pandai berenang lebih dahulu terjun ke laut dan naik ke darat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the rest to follow, some on planks, and some on other things from the ship. So it happened that they all escaped safely to the land.

block.text: dan supaya orang-orang lain menyusul dengan mempergunakan papan atau pecahan-pecahan kapal. Demikianlah mereka semua selamat naik ke darat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 28
When we had escaped, then they learned that the island was called Malta.

block.text: Setelah kami tiba dengan selamat di pantai, barulah kami tahu, bahwa daratan itu adalah pulau Malta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The natives showed us uncommon kindness. They kindled a fire, and received us all, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.

block.text: Penduduk pulau itu sangat ramah terhadap kami. Mereka menyalakan api besar dan mengajak kami semua ke situ karena telah mulai hujan dan hawanya dingin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks and laid them on the fire, a viper came out because of the heat, and fastened on his hand.

block.text: Ketika Paulus memungut seberkas ranting-ranting dan meletakkannya di atas api, keluarlah seekor ular beludak karena panasnya api itu, lalu menggigit tangannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand, they said one to another,

block.text: Ketika orang-orang itu melihat ular itu terpaut pada tangan Paulus, mereka berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No doubt this man is a murderer. Though he has escaped from the sea, Justice has not allowed him to live.”

block.text: <<Orang ini sudah pasti seorang pembunuh, sebab, meskipun ia telah luput dari laut, ia tidak dibiarkan hidup oleh Dewi Keadilan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: However he shook off the creature into the fire, and wasn't harmed.

block.text: Tetapi Paulus mengibaskan ular itu ke dalam api, dan ia sama sekali tidak menderita sesuatu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they expected that he would have swollen or fallen down dead suddenly. But when they watched for a long time and saw nothing bad happen to him, they changed their minds, and said,

block.text: Namun mereka menyangka, bahwa ia akan bengkak atau akan mati rebah seketika itu juga. Tetapi sesudah lama menanti-nanti, mereka melihat, bahwa tidak ada apa-apa yang terjadi padanya, maka sebaliknya mereka berpendapat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is a god!”

block.text: bahwa ia seorang dewa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in the neighborhood of that place were lands belonging to the chief man of the island, named Publius. He received us, and courteously entertained us for three days.

block.text: Tidak jauh dari tempat itu ada tanah milik gubernur pulau itu. Gubernur itu namanya Publius. Ia menyambut kami dan menjamu kami dengan ramahnya selama tiga hari.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that the father of Publius lay sick of fever and dysentery. Paul entered in to him, prayed, and laying his hands on him, healed him.

block.text: Ketika itu ayah Publius terbaring karena sakit demam dan disentri. Paulus masuk ke kamarnya; ia berdoa serta menumpangkan tangan ke atasnya dan menyembuhkan dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then when this was done, the rest also who had diseases in the island came, and were cured.

block.text: Sesudah peristiwa itu datanglah juga orang-orang sakit lain dari pulau itu dan merekapun disembuhkan juga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They also honored us with many honors, and when we sailed, they put on board the things that we needed.

block.text: Mereka sangat menghormati kami dan ketika kami bertolak, mereka menyediakan segala sesuatu yang kami perlukan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After three months, we set sail in a ship of Alexandria. It had wintered in the island, and its name was “The Twin Brothers.”

block.text: Tiga bulan kemudian kami berangkat dari situ naik sebuah kapal dari Aleksandria yang selama musim dingin berlabuh di pulau itu. Kapal itu memakai lambang Dioskuri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Touching at Syracuse, we stayed there three days.

block.text: Kami singgah di Sirakusa dan tinggal di situ tiga hari lamanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From there we circled around and arrived at Rhegium. After one day, a south wind sprang up, and on the second day we came to Puteoli.

block.text: Dari situ kami menyusur pantai, lalu sampai ke Regium. Sehari kemudian bertiuplah angin selatan dan pada hari kedua sampailah kami di Putioli.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There we found brothers, and were entreated to stay with them for seven days. So we came to Rome.

block.text: Di situ kami berjumpa dengan anggota-anggota jemaat, dan atas undangan mereka kami tinggal tujuh hari bersama-sama mereka. Sesudah itu kami berangkat ke Roma.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From there the brothers, when they heard of us, came to meet us as far as The Market of Appius and The Three Taverns. When Paul saw them, he thanked God, and took courage.

block.text: Saudara-saudara yang di sana telah mendengar tentang hal ihwal kami dan mereka datang menjumpai kami sampai ke Forum Apius dan Tres Taberne. Ketika Paulus melihat mereka, ia mengucap syukur kepada Allah lalu kuatlah hatinya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we entered into Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard, but Paul was allowed to stay by himself with the soldier who guarded him.

block.text: Setelah kami tiba di Roma, Paulus diperbolehkan tinggal dalam rumah sendiri bersama-sama seorang prajurit yang mengawalnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that after three days Paul called together those who were the leaders of the Jews. When they had come together, he said to them,

block.text: Itu terjadi setelah tiga hari Paulus disebut bersama-sama orang-orang yang para pemimpin Yahudi. Ketika mereka datang bersama-sama, ia berkata kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, I have done nothing against our people or against the customs of our ancestors. However, I was arrested in Jerusalem and was delivered to the Romans.

block.text: <<Saudara-saudara, meskipun aku tidak berbuat kesalahan terhadap bangsa kita atau terhadap adat istiadat nenek moyang kita, namun aku ditangkap di Yerusalem dan diserahkan kepada orang-orang Roma.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had examined me, they desired to set me free because there was no reason for the death penalty in my case.

block.text: Setelah aku diperiksa, mereka bermaksud melepaskan aku, karena tidak terdapat suatu kesalahanpun padaku yang setimpal dengan hukuman mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Jews objected and so I was compelled to appeal to Caesar. However, I had no charge to bring against my nation.

block.text: Akan tetapi orang-orang Yahudi menentangnya dan karena itu terpaksalah aku naik banding kepada Kaisar, tetapi bukan dengan maksud untuk mengadukan bangsaku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this cause therefore I asked to see you and to speak with you. For because of the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.”

block.text: Itulah sebabnya aku meminta, supaya aku melihat kamu dan berbicara dengan kamu, sebab justru karena pengharapan Israellah aku diikat dengan belenggu ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Akan tetapi mereka berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We neither received letters from Judea concerning you, nor did any of the brothers come here and report or speak any evil of you.

block.text: <<Kami tidak menerima surat-surat dari Yudea tentang engkau dan juga tidak seorangpun dari saudara-saudara kita datang memberitakan apa-apa yang jahat mengenai engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we desire to hear what your views are. For we know that people everywhere are talking against this sect.”

block.text: <<Tetapi kami ingin mendengar dari engkau, bagaimana pikiranmu, sebab tentang mazhab ini kami tahu, bahwa di mana-manapun ia mendapat perlawanan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had appointed him a day, many people came to him at his lodging. He explained to them, testifying about the Kingdom of God, and persuading them concerning Jesus, both from the law of Moses and from the prophets, from morning until evening.

block.text: Lalu mereka menentukan suatu hari untuk Paulus. Pada hari yang ditentukan itu datanglah mereka dalam jumlah besar ke tempat tumpangannya. Ia menerangkan dan memberi kesaksian kepada mereka tentang Kerajaan Allah; dan berdasarkan hukum Musa dan kitab para nabi ia berusaha meyakinkan mereka tentang Yesus. Hal itu berlangsung dari pagi sampai sore.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some believed the things which were spoken, and some disbelieved.

block.text: Ada yang dapat diyakinkan oleh perkataannya, ada yang tetap tidak percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they didn't agree among themselves, they departed after Paul had spoken one word,

block.text: Maka bubarlah pertemuan itu dengan tidak ada kesesuaian di antara mereka. Tetapi Paulus masih mengatakan perkataan yang satu ini:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Holy Spirit spoke rightly through Isaiah, the prophet, to our fathers, saying,

block.text: <<Tepatlah firman yang disampaikan Roh Kudus kepada nenek moyang kita dengan perantaraan nabi Yesaya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Go to this people, and say, in hearing, you will hear, but will in no way understand. In seeing, you will see, but will in no way perceive.

block.text: <Pergilah kepada bangsa ini, dan katakanlah: <<Kamu akan mendengar dan mendengar, namun tidak mengerti, kamu akan melihat dan melihat, namun tidak menanggap.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this people's heart has grown callous. Their ears are dull of hearing. Their eyes they have closed. Lest they should see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and would turn again, and I would heal them.’”

block.text: Sebab hati bangsa ini telah menebal, dan telinganya berat mendengar, dan matanya melekat tertutup; supaya jangan mereka melihat dengan matanya dan mendengar dengan telinganya dan mengerti dengan hatinya, lalu berbalik sehingga Aku menyembuhkan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be it known therefore to you, that the salvation of God is sent to the nations. They will also listen.”

block.text: Sebab itu kamu harus tahu, bahwa keselamatan yang dari pada Allah ini disampaikan kepada bangsa-bangsa lain dan mereka akan mendengarnya.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said these words, the Jews departed, having a great dispute among themselves.

block.text: (Dan setelah Paulus berkata demikian, pergilah orang-orang Yahudi itu dengan banyak perbedaan paham antara mereka.)

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul stayed two whole years in his own rented house, and received all who were coming to him.

block.text: Dan Paulus tinggal dua tahun penuh di rumah yang disewanya sendiri itu; ia menerima semua orang yang datang kepadanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He preached the Kingdom of God, and taught the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness and without hindrance.

block.text: Dengan terus terang dan tanpa rintangan apa-apa ia memberitakan Kerajaan Allah dan mengajar tentang Tuhan Yesus Kristus.
